text: Nice patio. Love the umbrellas to block sun while enjoying nice weather. Good drinks. Service should be faster and more consistent. We ordered the same two drinks twice and both our drinks were vastly different round to round.

LOVE this neighborhood bar for chill day drinking sessions on their patio or happy hour after a long day. My personal favorite is to get their nachos! I always get them with chicken and I'm never disappointed. Great size for the price (~$13)! Staff is attentive and laid back. Never a bad experience here

This place really really sucks the food was good but the experience just ruined everything for me with sucks to say because i was so excited for the patio. The management is absolutely horrible. Servers were good. Managers were unbearable . I had the worst experience here with a manager named Keith and another taller one with a beard. They were rude and not professional AT ALL. DO NOT GO TO THIS ESTABLISHMENT

Leave a cash tip, or no tip as the servers have no problem stealing from patrons after horrible service. Their slick addition of one dollar to each credit transaction adds up for them. What a horrible practice. I will not be returning.

The drinks here are waaaay to sweet. Tried a drink with whiskey and raspberry tea that tasted like candy. The whiskey sour was all sweet, no sour. The manhattan was extremely sugary too. Our server was nice. Super slow though. And the overall ambience and set up is cool. Lots of open air and outdoor seating.  Overall, good environment but the drinks are just ok.

This review is solely based on the drinks, which were excellent. The drinks were strong, which I appreciate. I would def recommend trying the frozen sangria it was so good! Check your cups, someone in our party got a dirty cup with someone else's lipstick on it.

This was once a place to go. Not any more. Pretentious and bland food. Twenty five years ago the place rocked. Now the owners seem to not care anymore. Outdoor dining and bad wait staff is not a good combination.

In response to whomever the "gentleman" is that responded back to my comment (ahem, 7 months later), is completely wrong and was not present. Not sure why the guy being a football player (which he absolutely isn't), would matter how he treats a patron. The "too big to throw out" comment was NOT a joke as I said, "is this a joke?" And the manager said, "no, I'm sorry it's not.". Your response is just as disgusting as the actions that took place that night. No wonder this is allowed at the establishment with supporters like you.
Pretty decent happy hour. 'First Bites' are half off. We had the nachos, protein was extra. They were great! Plenty to share as well.  Drink specials until 7. Nice patio!

It's close by and I don't expect a lot here so it's perfect for simple bar fare. They have sweet potato fries and a good burger. (W/bacon) decent whiskey selection and okay taps. Service is usually friendly and coherent. That's not a guarantee in a lot of sports/local bars.

Great for brunch with friends to cure a hangover haha. I loved the croissant and sweet butter. Bloody Mary was extra potent as well! Beautifully and naturally well lit. Huge ceiling windows allowing sun to pour in. Big bar area with tvs as well as great indoor and outdoor seating. Whatever floats your boat.

I like northside! I've been here a couple of times now. Drinks are good and food is pretty good. Not too crowded but still fun on the weekend. Good for watching games. Nice in the summer with the open roof.
They've never had good food, but at least before the renovation it was a fun atmosphere. Came here for the drinks and pool. No reason to any more.

What a cool place!  We were seated in the atrium area. Lots of plants- feels like I am outside. Sports on the tvs everywhere. We came here on Sunday- they had brunch and lunch for choices. Loved the menu choices- it was hard to decide. Great drink menu-lots of great beer. Bloody Mary's look delicious !  Will come back when I'm not on a diet and can drink. I ordered the southwest chicken salad with dressing on the side. Delicious. My husband got the turkey burger with sweet potato fries. The pretzel bun was amazing and I loved the sweet potato fries. Service was fast- got our iced tea right away. Great burger , salad and beer place !!  Love it- will be back!!
I want to like this place more, but it's just ok. Food... meh. Drinks.... meh. Service... eh. The atrium is bright and airy and nice patio during the warmer months.

Always loved this place.,haven't been back since moving. Suspect it as good as always. Loved the burger and BBQ chicken sandwich. Parking can be tough. Weekend garden eating is great. Staff always seemed awesome.
The wings, the music, what else can I say! The perfect after work spot to unwind & have a few brews! The service is great & the ambience is amazing. Will definitely be coming back again!
Great brunch, lots of tvs for football, and awesome apps. It can get a bit noisy on the patio. Order the nachos or the bourbon bbq boneless wings, skip the bratwurst.
Wednesday's after 7 $5 cocktails. Great deal for delicious drinks. Cool environment, good music, tvs with sports on.

I've always been a fan of the food and the ambiance....although I'm slightly disappointed that they have removed their pool table. They have a great beer selection, good burgers, great nachos. The smoking patio is a god-send for those who don't want to stand outside in the cold.  I recently had a birthday gathering there, and everyone had a great time. I had one complaint related to that night and, after being contacted by their owner, I feel as though someone who cares that much about the integrity and the reputation of their business deserves to be given a fair shot. Recommended. One of the better spots in Wicker.
We really had a great time at Northside Bar tonight. The place was nice and warm, the staff were really friendly and the food was great.  We would definitely come back again.

Didn't order food but had a few drinks. They have a nice selection of beers as well as cocktails and the menu did look appealing as far as the atmosphere the out door seating is perfect for the summer and the staff was super nice worth a chance

Rating simply on happy hour and beer garden. Love the atmosphere here. And half priced draft beer from 4-7pm, Monday - Friday, is right up my alley!   As a sports fan, I also like that they have several tvs around.

Pretty nice layout inside.  Solid patio and open space so you get a lot of fresh air. But good lord stay away from the shots.  We ordered a few shots of Jamo and they were about 70% water.  Wine coolers have more alcohol than that did, it tasted like drinking some flat ass pop that's been opened for weeks.  We ordered two rounds of it because we thought the first was a fluke, but it was not.  Huge rip off.

Surprised at the bad reviews, Northside is great! The outdoor seating is really nice and the whole place has a great, lively atmosphere. I personally think the food is pretty good. Even the non-vegetarians said that my black bean burger was delicious. The portions are HUGE! Unless you have a ginormous appetite (like me) you will probably end up bringing home left overs. The restaurant is really low key, and is great for a casual drink or lunch.

I am usually not the kind of person to write something negative,  but this really bothered me. A friend of mines and me who haven't caught up in a long time,  came here last night for the first time to chill,  eat and drink. We are ceative people and pretty chill, so we got lured in by the nice outward appearance. So we had to wait a long time to finally be served,  I almost had left cause I didn't have time to waste,  I am about the business,  but I was gonna give them the benefit of the doubt. I was in a good mood from earlier in the day.. despite the wait. So we order our food and drinks, then when our drinks are coming, the waitor gives my friend his drink, then givess off my drink to someone who ordered it at another table,  that was rude cause he was supposed to finish at our table. He asked who order the vodka and i raised my hand but he gave it to another table,  even after seeing me. Also when we got our food, we had received no utensils. On top of this, the music selection sucked badly. It was like some futuristic jungle music, definitely a buzz kill. The vodka was probably watered down because I barely tasted it,  I tasted more limed soda water. I hadn't been in Wicker Park for a while and wanted to see what else there was to do, I was traveling to many places,  but I wanted to go to some new good places back in my city. Unfortunately, this isn't a place I want to come back to and getting treated like this after traveling for so long. I had better service in other countries,  than here. I have never experienced the kind of service and treatment from this place from any other place in America, France, Russia or Guatemala.This service is even worse then the service I get at McDonald's in Chicago. I at first was thinking that some racism was going on, because we are two hispanics,  but now I've read many yelp reviews and noticed the constant trend of bad service. How embarrasing, I can't imagine how tourists would get treated and then they would judge Chicago based on something like that. Thats a lot of potential business that you guys would loose out on. Awful!. I wouldn't even dare to celebrate anything here nor do I wish this on my enemies..  I just to puke from how full I got from all of this negativity..  I keep it real from my perspective. That's why people question why businesses close down eventually,  because customers and their satisfaction comes first. If you do otherwise, nothing good will come from it. I gave my tip to the bus boy, because he was working hard and helped accommodate me better. Definitely a unique place for it's (bad) service in the wonderful Wicker Park area.  The only good stuff that I can say is: Good food,  good environment, nice restaurant and bar look...Sadly there's too much negativity that counteracts the good.

Went here for lunch with my cousin after pride parade last year and had terrible customer service.  My cousin thought it'd be a good idea to let he manager know and manager didn't seem to care. The food was great though. Great looking patio.
Waitress forgot to bring the wine, and also messed up our order. It was frustrating to eat a dish that we didn't order

Northside Bar and Grill is an American style restaurant in Chicago's Wicker Park, close to the blue line.  I came here with a large group on a Sunday afternoon for my friend's B day bar crawl, this was our second stop. My friend made reservations for us weeks before, but when we walked in, it was so disorganized. The hostess told us we could sit anywhere we wanted by the back bar, there were no tables arranged for us, so we sat around the back bar, and waited, but then the waitress told us there was no bar tender at the back bar. There were a ton of people back there, and I was shocked that they didn't have a bar tender at the bar where every seat was taken. Oh well, the waitress came up and told us to let her know if we needed anything, and then we never saw her again, some of us went to the bar to get drinks, but I guess the waitress told the bar tender that we were supposed to get drinks from her, and the  bar tender refused to serve us, We were planning on being there for a couple of hours, I had one drink, wanted at least one more, but literally could not order it because of the poor service, so we ended up leaving and getting drinks at the next place. The service was so bad that a group of 15 people walked out, and no one even acknowledged us as we were leaving. We had such great experiences at the other bars we went to, I doubt I will come back to Northside.

Legit spot on a nice warm day to grab a John Daley or a Moscow Mule. Have been here a few times for drinks and have always had a pleasant time. Staff and bar tenders are fantastic. Ambiance is chill and they do have TV's to catch the games.
Super cool vibe. The staff was fast and friendly.  The Ginger Soy Chicken Bites are the bomb. I would revisit this place for sure.

The reviews for Northside are conflicting, but this place filled the criteria for what we wanted:  a patio and a solid cocktail and beer list. Daydrinking, night drinking, inbetween drinking...if you're in Wicker Park, Northside should be on your list, especially on a sunny day.  Four of us came on a Friday afternoon, and the patio was full!  Luckily, we got a table on the cusp of being both inside and outside. The $8 booze slushies are a deal!  The two flavors that day, Strawberry Basil and Blackberry/Raspberry were both good.  The booze snuck up on us.  I had 2, got up to leave, and was feeling GOOD.  The slushies had actual fruit in them, I could see raspberry seeds and pulp, so they aren't skimping by using syrups here. We shared some appetizers, the BLT dip and the Irish nachos, but neither were anything special.  My friend had the fish tacos, but the mango was not ripened and was hard.  There are so many spots for good food around here, so go elsewhere for food. I can't hate this place though.  We had a great time, and the drinks were good.
the service was good,but the burger was overcooked. trash on dining room floor not very conducive to food prices. will never go back.

The building itself was awesome and we were seated next to the fireplace which was great for the rainy Sunday afternoon.  The service was ridiculously slow. Especially considering there weren't that many people dining and they were fully staffed. We ordered the fried chicken sandwich and the falafel wrap. The fried chicken sandwich was by far the best thing. It was crispy and the slaw made a great combination. The dish came with mediocre sweet potato fries. The falafel wrap was terrible. It was basically just filled to the brim in B grade hummus. I couldn't even tell what the falafel itself tasted like. There were a little bit vegetables (I think) lost in the swamp of hummus and I couldn't even enjoy the side of tzatziki sauce  because the wrap was soggy enough. I would never eat here again.
Great spot.  They even have yummy margaritas:)  Great beer selection and good vibe, cool staff....always awesome service.

Come here for drinks, not food.  We came on a Sunday afternoon around 3 and the place was still pretty busy. We got seated in the really cool atrium part, and we really liked how everything was decorated inside.  Unfortunately, our service was far below average and the food was just OK at best.  Great atmosphere for drinks, nothing else.

I have been here a handful of times and the last two have been really sub-par.  Last fall, my boyfriend and I came by early on a Saturday and sat by their fire.  I ordered a bourbon old-fashioned and was given a cheap whiskey.  I watched for our waitress for over 20 minutes before we finally caught her.  Today, we tried this place again bc it was sunny and we wanted to sit near the patio.  The first drink I ordered (the Paloma) tasted like what you find at the bottom of a dumpster.  I asked for a Four Roses bourbon instead without mentioning the awful Paloma.  The bourbon, which is normally a deep red, was lighter than my boyfriend's IPA.  We are never coming back here- awful cocktails and watered down booze. The waitress charged me both for the obviously watered down bourbon and the awful cocktail that I took one sip of....

Was there on Monday with my friend, got in with a few minutes left of Happy Hour.  Our waitress took our order and gave us a heads up that it might take a little bit being as everyone placed orders.  We didn't wait long at all!  We had the buffalo chicken strips which I thought were very good.  Very meaty and not all breading.  The hummas was nothing special.  They did put tomato on top of the pita which made it a bit soggy.  The drinks were delish.  Our waitress was very attentive.  I'd go back.

I ate here Saturday night and got food poisoning! I had the pulled pork sandwich with cole slaw and sweet potato fries. The fries tasted fine, but the slaw and sandwich were not good. Please do not eat at this place. The management needs to check the food handling processes because this is dangerous!

Ate here/stopped in for drinks here many times over my decade in Chicago.  It serves a valuable purpose in the neighborhood as being: 1.) decent food (though it can be hit or miss); 2.) decent service; 3.) not oozing with pretension in a neighborhood that is oozing with pretension; and 4.) not too crowded or pricey.  Northside was a reliable plan B or C when Plan A or Plan B was too crowded.  That being said, it was usually pretty full itself, though never to the extent of having a 45 minute-1hr wait like some trendier joints in the neighborhood do. The outdoor patio always has had a nice ambiance, especially in the afternoon, and most of the time it is relatively clean.  On a nice day in Chicago, it really can't be beat.  Indoors is a little more dank/divey but if you're just looking for a drink, it's not really a problem.   If you're in Wicker Park, and don't feel like shelling out $40+/person for a drink & brunch or lunch that will leave you hungry again in an hour, roll into Northside. My biggest complaints would be those occasions where the service was slow, or the waitress forgot something, or food would be under-cooked or over-cooked.  But like I said, I've eaten there dozens of times over many year, and issues were relatively rare.  Kudos for being solid and unremarkable, Northside!

Oyyy what a trashy place. Sassy and unhappy staff/management make an art of poor service. I have to specifically call out their manager, Andrew, who kicked out my friend for taking a chip/salsa from a neighboring party. Poor form on my friend's part, but the ejection was bizarre and extreme and left almost as bad a taste in our mouths as their food. Great alternatives in the neighborhood so steer clear of this dumpy bar.

I love Northside! Drinks are good, but the real winner here is the decor and inside/outside courtyard! I love being able to go there on a cold day, sit by one of there many fire places and still get the sunlight from outside! Picture the worlds largest skylight, with plants, wicker furniture, and alcohol. It's essentially this girls dream. Good option for the colder months, but Summer, I'm coming for ya.

Oh, Northside, how we love you and your outdoor area. Your servers are awesome and your food is good; but, for the love of all that is holy, please install a diaper changing table in the bathroom. I promise it won't hurt your facade of being a "bar". Parents need to drink, too. Put it in the women's bathroom, even, and no one will blink an eye. Otherwise, we'll continue to have to use the booths where other patrons sit or your pool tables to change poopy diapers. Do you really want that?!

Great for visitors who want to experience the best of mid-western culture; great for the owners who have long ago tapped into and cashed in on the zeitgeist of the mid-west; and great for people who think that the good life involves being banal, surrounding themselves with like-minded strangers, eating fatty/salty food, sucking down fumes of alcohol and car exhaust, and paying a premium for the experience. If you drink enough alcohol, than this place can be a loud and fun place to watch people and grab an appetizer or a light meal. So unless you get a seat in the patio close the street then you should probably skip it. Because it's not worth it for the food. Great for tourists who don't know any better, or locals who only eat in bars or are too rich to give a hoot.  I won't bother with what we ordered or the service, because like I just said, it's not that kind of joint. Basically it's glorified bar-fare; wings, calamari etc., with extra salt and sauces to cover up the fact that you're eating frozen, canned, massed produced, unsustainable and overpriced junk food.
Northside is a really fun place to go to and hang out watch sports and they have good food. I wish they would add some new appetizers but overall it's a fun place to hang out.

Grabbed a quick lunch recently. Sat at the bar and was pleased with the service and food.  The Buffalo Calamari is not something you see every day and it was great. The soup, Potato-cheese something or another, was very bland and tasted like Sysco Soup from a bag. For a place that makes its own dressing, I expect a more creative profile in a featured soup. Meh. Slightly above average whiskey selection and service with a smile was adds bonus. This place is deceiving my large and I'd think big parties would be fun.
The atmosphere is amazing and the staff is very friendly. Excellent assortment of beers and drinks

Small menu but the food is amazing. I got the Reuben and it was phenomenal. My friend got the pulled pork quesadillas which looked equally as good. My favorite part of this place is the building itself. The atrium provides a Very bright dining room and  the fireplace makes it cozy

Went in here a few Saturdays ago to grab a quick meal and drink..my server gave me excellent server but my entire meal was DISRUPTED by one of the managers yelling at one of the servers 10 FEET from my table. Excuse me, but if i'm paying 25 dollars for lunch i dont want to be interrupted by this type of immaturity.

The owner contacted me and explained they were short handed due to unseasonably warm weather. Which is reasonable. Doesn't explain the super tiny side of fries though. A for effort on reaching out though.
Cool beer garden atmosphere, and you can almost always get a seat. Food is just ok.

This is the best beer garden and patio in Wicker Park!  The food is good, but the menu is limited, and the service is usually good.  They usually offer a few specials which helps to expand the regular menu. My favorites include fish tacos, southwestern salad, and fajitas.
My husband and I have always liked this bar and returned the other evening after many years of not going.  Love the beautiful beer garden.  Very relaxing.  Enjoyed my Revolution beer.  Great spot.
I love their outdoor seating. It is so beautifully decorated. The food is so-so. Nothing special. I wish they had a bigger menu.

Servers don't know the menu and food is crappy at best.  Have had a couple items over time here as they are a large space that can usually take a walk in.  Won't be back. Food is boring and takes forever on a weekend and staff are on their phones and not taking care of the guest.  Too many good options nearby to go back again.

This place could be soooo good. It's prime real estate and a truly beautiful place inside. It comes down to the bad staff and cooks. They just don't care. I hope they get on bar makeover because there is a ton of potential here.
Get the Fried chicken sandwich. Burger is bomb. Fries good.  Cocktails are good and fair beer selection. Great service.
Service was okay and food was just okay. Nice beer garden though.

So here you have your typical sort of Bar and Grill situated along the main drag on Damen in Wicker Park.  In a location full of attempts at fancier fare, I was pleasantly surprised when I stopped in here dying of thirst to discover that it's actually relatively quality food.   The pulled pork quesadillas were fantastic.  The pork was well done, very flavorful and juicy.  The salads are fresh and tasty.  I think I had the southwest chicken salad.  Chicken, black beans, onion, avocado.  You know the one.   Finally they have an impressive drink selection as well.  Worth the stop if you're passing through.

This is our go to place for a drink and appetizer outside while people watching in the area.  I can't really speak to the entrees but we usually order the hummus which is a good portion.  Although I wish there were more vegetables on the platter.  You can't really ruin beer and it always tastes pretty good on a warm day.  I really love the atmosphere here though.  They have great outdoor space and you never know who you are going to see..  We once saw a really drunk, obnoxious Dennis Rodman drinking here.  It's location is even better now with the 606 right down the street, so go for a walk and then stop in for a drink!

They have really dropped the ball,, the food was terrible , the staff acted like we were bothering them ..and what bar runs out of not 1 but four premium liquors ...really pulled pork quesadillas...more like  thrown beef on a tortilla with barbecue sause...the writing is on the wall , when a place is just going through the motions till they sell ..the menu is so  far left that ..it has left ...wings are still good..places are supposed to progress as they go not regress ...I wish this place the best of luck they are going to need it ..very sad..

We came to the restaurant on a Thursday night. It was dinner time and the place was populated, but we were seated immediately. Generally, the place is very nice looking and comfortable. The beer garden is very cool and definitely a cool place to hang out. That is all that was good here. They have the same menu and construction as Logan Bar in Logan Square. That said, Logan Bar does everything right whereas this place is awful. The food was soggy and unimpressive, we sat for 15 minutes before the joke of a waitress even have us water. Then we waited another 10 minutes for draft beers to arrive, the place was not that busy. Generally, the wait staff was unresponsive to complaints big or small and management never came to our table. In the end, go to Logan Bar. They still care about the menu and do those items correctly. You can also avoid the nightmare of dining at this establishment. 2 stars for location

Been coming here for years.  I thought I already wrote a review oh well.  For the most part, I've always enjoyed coming to this place.  its a good people watch, good food, good beer selection.  Came here on Tuesday and the service was very good. Then we decided to go back the next day 06/10/15, and this time, the hostess was rude and cynical.  Two hostess were standing at the hostess table..one said how many and we said two and the other quickly said, 'there are no seats' just whatever you can find at the bar.'...in a very rude, dismissive way.  didn't politely say she would let us know when a table became available and would get us from the bar.  so we just walked away and they let us.  in over 10 years i've been coming here, i've never been treated that way or spoken to in that way...they should probably do some serious customer service training or not hire inexperienced people.  there is no room for that in this town.

Hadn't been here in years - glad to see that Northside has weathered all the neighborhood changes and is still there. The best part of Northside is the huge patio - it's enclosed, and away from the street, so it's a nice private place to eat off of the hustle and bustle of Damen/North/Milwaukee. I had a black bean burger and sweet potato fries. The burger tasted like a basic veggie burger, but the fries were perfect - crispy on the outside, soft on the inside, and not soggy. And the mango chutney was a nice touch. Wish they had a more extensive menu, especially more veggie items - only 2 appetizers and 2 sandwiches were vegetarian, everything else on the menu had meat in it, even the salads. Didn't get a beer but looks like a great selection. Nice place to chill on the patio.

Well, stopped in here for a cocktail and was very disappointed. First they were out of a few drink ingredients which eliminated some of the best cocktails on the menu, second it took about 15 minutes get our two mixed drinks, it was Sunday night and the place was mostly empty, it took the manager stopping by before we were served, third the Manhattan was very watery. Fourth we had to ask get a check at the host stand because all three servers we chatting in the server alley. Another 5 minutes go by and no check, so I walked to bar to return my watery drink and request a check. Finally we get the bill without the smallest attempt at an apology for the watery drink, terrible service and the fact that we paid full price for the experience. I wish I could give this place fewer stars. If it was busy and I had this experience I would understand but with 1 server for every 3 guests this was unacceptable.
Neat bar, great for outside / shaded sitting.   I went mostly for the bier Garten and ambiance rather than the food, but everyone I was with who ate was pleased with their selections.

Awesome place with outdoor seating! I've been twice and every time its a great experience.  I tried the spicy black bean burger, amazing burger!  My second visit I got the BBQ pulled pork which was awesome!  The portions are quite generous compared to price.

Northside has a beautiful atmosphere. They have a really nice porch, and a bar with glass ceiling so even in the winter it seems warm and bright.  The food was delicious. I had the Kentucky Pulled Pork and a salad. The sandwich was huge! I only ate half of it.

I have to give 3 stars for the SOLE PURPOSE they took away the buffalo calamari. It's a craving in our household and was very unfortunate to learn they left it on the menu but won't serve it, ever. Again. Please bring it back.  Great beer selection and patio, otherwise!

Definitely my favorite date night place in wicker park. The closed in porch, the indoor trees and the rustic decor make for the perfect date night atmosphere. So many beers on the menu and they have super unique dishes that never disappoint. Had the falafel salad special tonight and literally scraped my plate. It's the kind of place that you can chill all night and the staff makes you feel welcome the entire time!

3.5 stars Chill place to go for drinks. They have a nice outdoor patio for hanging out and people watching (it obviously gets crowded on those beautiful warm Chicago days). We went here mainly for drinks, but ended up getting the hot wings when we smelled them from someone else's table; the hot wings were just ok. Servers are friendly, but can be slow. They had a good draught beer list and drink prices were fair. Pretty fun environment too, as everyone else seemed to be there for drinks and a good time as well. I could see myself coming back again.

Wandered in here to watch a game; and ended up finding a new favorite hangout in the area. Impeccable decor makes it a 4-season wonder, with a beautiful bar, gorgeous outside season, and 4-seasson rooms with plants, televisions, and fireplaces. The waitress and bartender were knowledgeable and helpful in making a creative mixed drink. The food was good (Though certainly not Chicago's best, in the upper quartile easily), but the atmosphere was so tremendous that we frankly didn't have a chance to focus.  Northside is really an excellent space, with a small-but-great drought list, and a well-done food menu. We have and will continue to go here when in Wicker Park.

Honestly I rarely review but my experience here was terrible. My buddy and I ordered a couple of drinks with wings and sat out on the front patio area. That was nice. However our waitress was completely rude and unprofessional. She accidentally switched my bill with someone else's ( I get it things happen) however just telling me " we have to recharge your card give me your card" with an attitude without explaining why I'm being charged twice and charging me for both checks was uncalled for. I asked for a manager and luckily he had some sense to at least explain the situation to me further. However I feel at least comp something or earn my business for the mistake. Simple gestures for a mistake like that would yield return customers who would continue to patronize your establishment.

Come to this place for the environment, not so much the food. The patio/courtyard area is amazing in the summer and warm and cozy in the winter with plenty of fireplaces. They have pool and video games in the back and tons of tvs. The food is decent but nothing to write home about.
Had the spicy chicken breaded sandwhich and it was delicious!!! I would def recommend it to anyone!

This place is pretty solid. We went here for lunch on a Saturday -- good food and pretty good drink selection. I was leaning toward 4 stars, but the service was just okay (we had to keep asking for basics like silverware and refills).  In addition -- a group of drunk people were being obnoxious and knocked over a chair at our table. I'm not faulting the restaurant for these people, but just be aware that there are some pretty heavy drinkers present even at 1pm. May not be the best location for kids.  Not far from the Damen Blue Line stop, I'm looking forward to trying this place again.

Went here this evening with my sister and my baby for a drink and appetizers around 6 or so. It took the hostess like 10 minutes to come seat us and she very rudely told me to 'put my stoller over there.' I did, no questions asked. Our waitress was very kind. She kneeled down to talk to us, made recommendations, it was great. I needed to change my baby's diaper, and there is NO CHANGING TABLE in the bathroom! I ended up changing him IN THE STROLLER. I'm disappointed because now I know how difficult it will be to come back here in the future-and I like it! The windows, fireplaces, etc. Please add a changing table, there's room in the women's bathroom. Please make it a little more family friendly!

Came here for light night snack and drinks.  It took about 15 minutes after we sat for our waitress to ask what we would like. As a former waiter, I usually give them the benefit of the doubt. But the restaurant was not that busy and there were many open tables near us. By that time she came to our table, we had just gone up to the bar area. We order a side of sweet potato fries that were average. However, lost a star on service here.

I've here many times-mostly for lunch. Good food generally-better than average pub fare and daily specials. I happen to try their steak and eggs today and it's easily the best dish I've ever had here. Hoping it doesn't go away-it may be a weekend breakfast/brunch thing that I never get to see. Flatiron steak cooked right, delicious potato gratin, brioche toast, couple of eggs and some bacon jam. Highly recommended. They've a respectable craft beer program as well.

A couple friends and I would come here often in the summer just for the food, especially the burgers!  Really chill place to sit and have a beer or two with some friends, or just to dine in. Not so much for dancing or a spot to get hammered with friends.  Friendly staff, decently priced, fast service.

While visiting Chicago, a friend took us here for beers and we were delighted with a handful or so unique brews on tap.  I delighted in the chocolate milk stout which I highly recommend! Nice ambiance and well located in wicker park
You know what you are getting every time you come here. Simple spot to sit and eat that's sports casual friendly. Beer and pleasantly good food selections for the chill atmosphere.
One of our favorite mid week spots. The service could be better but the atmosphere is super relaxing and inviting.

Nothing but love for this place.  Pub food preselected favorites including fish tacos.  I had the black bean burger on a pretzel bun.  It was one of the best delicacies I've had in a long time.   Unique beers on draught too.  Muddy Puppy Porter was delicious!!  Nice friendly wait staff too.
Summer spot in my neighborhood! Reminds me of being in college...good looking people come here! Their outdoor seating is awesome!

This is my favorite bar in Wicker, but this review excludes the food. Ate here once a while back and it was fine from what I recall, but mostly I just love the bar.  Love the open/patio area and the beer selection. Great crowd of people, not too rowdy and just an overall easy, cool vibe. Would probably recommend for almost any occasion - date or group of friends. Well, not any occasion, I guess. Probably not a good spot for like an intervention.

Northside's got it all -- lots of space that's organized into various sections each with its own vibe. For example, you have two good-sized bars inside, with many draft and bottled beer options as well as all the booze you would expect. There's a giant patio that gets a "roof" and a fireplace for the winter months, as well as a couple loungier areas with couches & leather chairs. Finally, there's the game area with Buck Hunter and a pool table. On the weekends, they also have rotating DJs (the kind who use turntables!).  Northside's main menu is straight-forward pub fare, but definitely check out the excellent fish tacos and ginger-soy glazed chicken bites with edamame if you want something a little left of the center. The crowd here is pretty mixed in terms of age/background and comes mostly from the neighborhood, so it's laid back & casual. Really fun overall!

I came here twice and both times got garbage service. The first time we had to get up and ask who our waitress was 20 minutes after being seated. Second time they were dead and same situation, waitresses kept walking past our table knowing we hadn't been helped yet. Eventually had to ask. Besides the shitty service the nachos are good, the only reason I came back a second time.

this is a very Good bucktown sports bar w a great view of the 'Hood.  Beer selection is very good so is the Liquor list. i drink mine straight so I cant speak to mixed drinks. the food is good middle of the road bar food.. anywhere the service can be off, but also the Customers can be off too, myself included.!! and by the looks of some long rants I am wondering and glad those people may not come back. Northside - is what it is,  A very Good neighbor hood bar w nice people.

The very humid July night we visited there was no AC running. The multiple bars are severely understaffed and the minimal bartenders are not too receptive. We had to wait 15-20 minutes just to order a drink. I couldn't even get the bartender to provide me with a glass of water. When my boyfriend ordered a stout he was given a Guiness.  The actual space is very nicely designed with couches and fireplaces. I would totally have a hot chocolate here and do a puzzle on a Monday morning. I will not, however, try to order a drink again on a weekend.

The outdoor seating was great and our waitress was very attendant and kind. The nachos were great, calamari just ok. The best part of my meal was the black beam burger which was actually out of this world and had an almost meat like texture. Also extensive beer selection that is not cheap but of good quality. Overall good experience and a great black bean burger.

fish and chips lots of great beers on tap appreciated the patio space large enough to accommodate an ever-changing party size as people came and went to hangout. servers were very nice and patient. no body even complained about a baby being present! food overall was average but service was great.
Great casual spot for good food, great patio and drinks.  Comfortable, fun and I have been going here for a long time. Neighborhood go to!

We were in Wicker Park on a sunny August afternoon, hungry, looking for an outdoor spot to eat = Northside to the rescue. The massive patio space still had plenty of open tables when we went on the early side for dinner, so we chose one in the sun and ordered a few beers to start.  This is a nice big patio and it's usually packed anytime I go by. I'm not surprised because it's a very pleasant atmosphere to have a casual bite to eat. The north wall is covered in climbing green plants and vines, and overhead is vaulted wood beams - it's pretty, it's casual, it's outdoorsy, and it's big.  We ordered two of the fish taco appetizers and I could have eaten 4 myself. They were delicious. Fried whitefish in double tortillas with a creamy sauce and mango salsa. So good. I had the southwest chicken salad as my entree, and that too was delicious and big.  Because we were dining with the early bird supper crowd (I have nothing against that), there were babies everywhere. Well, not everywhere, but we saw at least 6... including a cute one at the table next to us. I'm sure a more heavy-drinking crowd moves in as the night rolls on.

Great ambiance and interior setup. Good drink menu. Skip the food... Sub par bar menu and most items look and taste like something I can make myself. And I only know how to use a microwave. So, yea...

So, this placed surprised me!!! After a second time dinning there,it was fabulous!!! The service was on point, the drinks where delicious, and again my server Alicia, was wonderful. I had a horrible first impression, but Stephanie corrected it, and her service staff backed it up!!! I look forward to my next dinning experience! Thank you North Side for making it right!
Food's decent, outside seating is adequate. Place is decent in the summer. It get's crowded. Nothing outstanding, but a decent place.

I'm actually surprised this place only has 3 stars.  Got to sit outside which was perfect cause the weather was great.  I really liked the atmosphere too.  I ordered the reuben sandwich which was one of the best I've had in a while.  Sweet potato fries were okay nothing special. I liked the sauce they gave me on the side as well but the coleslaw was kinda gross tasted like onions.  Even tho I like onions I did not enjoy that at all.  Service was friendly as well even tho it was a little slow but what do you expect for a Friday evening.  Over all I would really recommend this place!

Okay. Was tired of old school lunch venues in Wicker Park. While saying heck w it, I popped into Northside. Sat down to be greeted with nothing but hospitality by the whole team. Jeanette our server pretty much made the experience. I'm kinda high maintenance (hangover) and she still rolled out the red carpet. Food incredible. Nice guys!

This place is one of my favorites in Wicker Park. We always head here for drinks and snacks while waiting for our Big Star reservations. When we're feeling impatient we'll skip Big Star and just stay here for dinner. The best feature of Northside is the cool indoor patio, and that you're seated without a wait. I highly recommend!

I WANT to give this place more stars on account of them having my favorite gin drink in the city (the Your Killin Me Smalls is stupid good). So the cocktails are good, beer selection average, food just okay. I wish I could say it's the service that sets this place apart, but I can't. And that's where this bar fails. I understand being busy, but multi-tasking isn't the strong suit of the staff. Katie is the fastest service I've had here. She's great! If you're coming just to chill out and throw back some drinks-you'll be fine. Their patio is AWESOME.

I have been to many bars in Chicago and if you are looking for some good food while putting back some drinks this is the place to go.  Compared to other bar food, Northside's menu definitely offers a better selection and quality.  On busy nights the service may be a tad slower, which is normal of any bar on a busy weekend. The laid back atmosphere is nice if you are trying to take a break from the hustle and bustle of Chicago city life.  Overall, I give this place 5 stars.

This place had okay food, horrible service, but a pretty cool inside atmosphere. My girlfriend and me were ignored by the wait staff for a half hour before we had to place our order at the bar. The waitress continued to ignore us the entire night and we had to walk to the bar for everything. Needless to say we will never go back, which is sad because we live so close to it. Bummer.

I stopped in last Sunday afternoon to catch the start of the hockey game and have a beer and a burger.  I was a solo diner seated at one of the tables in the bar. The waitresses walked by several times for 10 minutes or so before someone asked if I needed something.  As a female solo diner, I thought this was rude to assumed you have to be waiting for someone to show up before you can get service.  All restaurants should take notice there are more and more people out there now a day that can go solo with there smartphone in hand to keep them company.  The burger was average,  the service needs re - education. I live in the neighborhood so I'll be back to try again and hope for improvement.

This has always been a pretty reliable place (food is ok-usually little to no wait) but last Sunday was a complete disaster. We waited about 15 minutes for our waitress to appear and take our order then another 15 minutes for the drinks to arrive which were then dropped. That's fine, I get it, it happens. But then, our follow-up drinks never arrived. We had to ask another server for drinks & to take our food order. I am not sure how/why you do not staff properly for your restaurant when it's a weekend AND the Blackhawks are playing. The table next to us had the same issues. When they joked about not paying for their drinks once they finally did arrive (since they waited 30-40 minutes), the server didn't respond at all...I understand if you're overwhelmed but she gave no indication of really caring at all and barely acknowledged the really poor service. I am giving it two stars only because is has been a reliable place IN the winter, DURING the week, and when there is no major sporting event to attract the masses.

Stopped here on Sunday around 1:30. Outside seating had 40 min wait so we sat in bar area. Almost outside!  Nice beer options except first choice I picked they were out of. Told by waitress list may be old. Service very very slow. Grossly understaffed! When ordering something from brunch menu waitress said "what time is it?"  She was not sure if brunch still being served and had no idea of what time it was. Ordered a burger cooked medium well. Was very very well not so much medium.  Very mediocre.  Overall an ok place for setting but average food at slightly above average prices!

We go to this bar a lot, so I was raging today with how AWFUL it was. We sat down and waited about 10 minutes for our server. When she showed up we ordered our drinks and food. After waiting about 15 minutes for our drinks, the server dropped them on her way to us and that was the closest we got to our drinks here. After about 40 minutes our meals showed up COLD! Oh and still no drinks. My husband ordered a beer that came in a can! At this point I was so angry, we got up and left. I told the server we were leaving and she just said I'm sorry, we're short staffed. That excuse doesn't hold any weight with me when 1 person ordered a beer in a can and our food was cold. Bucktown/Wicker Park is not the place for having horrible service, because you might not be here much longer.

I just went last night for trivia. The announcer was kind of obnoxious. The food was okay--way overpriced--$12 for a frozen turkey burger and fries, and so were the drinks. Everything on the menu was a few dollars more than i'd expect to pay somewhere else in the city. Our waitress was sweet but overzealous and in our face a lot. Also, she was visibly and verbally disappointed when we wanted to move into the room with the trivia, even though I told the hostess we were there for the trivia before she sat us. Overall, not going back.
Dropped in for a snack and drinks...Margarita Pizza was meh and onion rings were burnt.

Plus: TV screens playing sports, generous amount of veggies for a side salad, nice local beer, friendly staff Minus: small beef burger(which left me hungry, after a $20 meal that includes a burger, a side salad and a beer)

This is by far the prettiest sports bar I've ever been to. We were ushered into a really neat atrium area with ivy covered walls and greenery everywhere. It was cold the day I visited but I could see it being a relaxing, casual summer hang out when the French doors are open to the patio. Being from Michigan, where sports is on in all restaurants all the time, the large screen tv's placed high on the wall felt like home. I ordered the a chicken, pear salad and a Bloody Mary for lunch. Although not necessarily awe- inspiring, the salad was good and filled me up during my afternoon shopping excursion. I'm easy to please and the  garnishment on my Bloody Mary was the selling feature of the drink. The ham, cheese, and olive spear didn't disappoint.

I don't usually write a review unless I really like the place or I have a qualm with it. I ordered the crispy chicken sandwich which was pretty decent so that's why this place gets 2 stars instead of 1. My issue was with the server trying to make a few extra bucks. The menu said the sandwich was $10.50, i was charged $12.50. My friends and I all split the check and I took a copy of my receipt saying with tip my total was $16.25. I check my bank statement today to find the waitress decided to add an extra dollar on top of that. I'm not trying to be a penny pincher but that kind of thing is enough to make me not come back. Hope the extra buck was worth it!

1 star for your so called "pizza" 4 stars for your Rye Sidecar The Margherita Pizza....is a BURRITO TORTILLA with sauce and cheese on it.  Now I know this is a bar, and not a pizzeria and you don't come here for the food, but please take this thing off your menu, it's making you look bad.  Do yourself a favor and order something else on the menu. Rye Sidecar was great, and it quickly made me forget about the "pizza".  The place itself is a decent place to get drinks and judging from the menu, looks like typical bar food.

Loud, but good music selection playing when we were there (late Friday evening, on Valentine's Day). We sat at a high-top across from the bar; waitress was good and attentive. My cocktail (Dark and Stormy) was STROOOOONG and almost undrinkable. I had to put my big girl panties on and just suck it down. The ginger beer was pretty non-existent in it. The general vibe was cool; maybe a little hipster-ish for the staff, but the crowd of patrons was mixed. I would go there again for a drink or two.  3.5 stars.

This is my favorite bar in the city.  They have the coolest atmosphere; I always feel like I'm at a bar in a ski resort when I'm here.  The exposed beams and greenery are nothing like you'll find anywhere in Chicago.  Their drinks are so well-priced and I always have such a nice relaxing time. I love this bar and their nachos :)

I've eaten here dozens of times since i live in the area, but the food is nothing special.  The place has been running the same boring menu for way too many years now - it's time for a refresh.  Burgers are bad quality meat, fries and wings are soggy, nachos come with stadium cheese sauce - the falafel or the brat are your best bets.  Service isn't bad for dining there, but they've screwed up my carry-out orders pretty often which is likely the fault of the flaky bartenders they seem to have here...or my own for never checking the food, but who wants to wait for them to cook the right items anyway.
Been to this bar probably 1.9 bajillion times- always good. Been sitting here for 3 hours with 2 servers walking by ignoring our existence so I joined yelp to bitch and hopefully get them in trouble.

I was blatantly ignored by the bartenders. Went out for my birthday and it took me 15 minutes to get a beer. I saw two people arrive at the bar after me get served before me. Happy birthday to me! Miserable. I stood next to a random patron and he said, "they're blatantly ignoring you"... Screw this bar. Biased and horrible service. You're welcome for the 20% tip bc I worked in the industry. No, really, I shouldn't have. I will never return.

Love the renovation here.  I thought the bar was cute before on the few occasions that I've stopped in for a drink or a quick bite, but I like what they've done with the outdoor space.  They've made it a more upscale space, but one that is still casual enough to relax for brunch or watch a sporting event.  During the Bears game this weekend, it was a mix of familes and groups watching the game and eating lunch.   The menu has a wide mix of food and everything I tried was pretty delicious.   Service was friendly and the hostess was nice to set us up with a table that was outside with a view of the tvs.  I was a bit disappointed that one of the tvs was switched to a NON-Chicago game, but I suppose I can let it pass this time since the Bears were embarrassing the city during this particular game anyway. Good spot in the neighborhood for a drink that definitely attracts a more preppy and slightly older (30's) crowd than some of the other spots nearby.

I met some friends at Northside a few weekends ago when it was chilly outside.  They still had the entire front open, and it was freezing inside.  I had a late lunch, so I didn't order anything to eat.  And I didn't really feel like drinking, so I didn't order anything to drink.  One of the things that scared me away from ordering food too was actually having a terrible experience with food at their sister location, Logan Square Bar & Grill.  Halfway through my visit, I decided I was kind of hungry and wanted to split nachos with another friend.  The server never came back so that we weren't able to order them.  The ambiance is great, but other than that, Northside doesn't have much to offer.

My husband and I went for dinner once and I went with a girl friend for drinks once.  Dinner was great.  We got seated at the table on the end of the completely outside seating - it was quiet and a little secluded and we loved it.  The staff was super happy and helpful and checked on us at every step.  Even those who weren't our servers.  Food was great - although I had some pina colada-ish drink that was awful. When I went for drinks with my girl friend, we had a nice time sitting at the bar.  $15 minimum for credit cards but on a girls day that's no problem.  I wasn't impressed with the attitude from the bar tender, however.  I was asking questions about the on tap selections and he seemed unhappy to have to answer them.   Overall, I liked it and we will go back.
Awesome spot!! Beautiful view, patio, scenery & servers.  Check it out!
Had dinner here the other night.  Nachos were excellent, but the burger was mediocre at best.  Lively crowd, if that is what you are looking for.
Cool patio, for sure.  Slow service, nothing super special about their menu, and a little crowded in terms of the layout.

I used to like this place when Wicker Park was practically deserted, and they made delicious wings here.  I went the other night, and sadly it has degenerated from a Pretty Good Bar to the typical packed, loud and increasingly-sloppy-as-the-night-goes-on giant barn. It's hard to imagine eating food here after about 9 PM when it gets utterly crowded and messy. Off my radar.

Since it's called Northside, it is generally frowned upon to twist up your fingers like snoop dogg and flash the westside; but don't worry there are no bloods or crips here.. I was here 2x in less than 1 week so yes, I dig this place.  The outdoor seating/atrium thing, etc - hard to beat. Even when it rains they have a tarp roof to put on the outdoor area so you stay dry. Drinks good, pulled pork nachos very good.  Other reviews knock the slow or rude service but get real. In Chicago these restaurant GM's and owners are trying to make as much money as they can and do it by not staffing adequately. Sadly this has become the norm at most places I frequent. Annoying? Yes. But is it any better or worse then anywhere else? No. The servers are cool and I like them but it just takes awhile to get your order/drink due to the lack of servers. -1 star We actually had an issue here during one of our visits that was beyond their control. They still recovered by buying our group a round of shots; I love a place that takes care of their patrons.  I'll be back, oh yes, I will be back..

I come here for the abundant outdoor seating and the DELICIOUS chips and salsa! They aren't on the menu anymore but the servers always work something out for me anyways ;) I'm disappointed in the reviews because I've always had a great experience here!

Will not be back.  Stopped in for lunch with my 3 year old last week. As we made our way to our table, I was shocked to see a middle aged, "beefy" guy eating without a shirt on with 1 dog on his lap and the other under the table.  The owner and manager did nothing even after I expressed my disappointment.  It was disgusting & insulting.  Later Northside!!!

Really good burger and sweet potato fries. Being gluten and dairy free, I have a hard time eating out. Needless to say, the I didn't have the bun but added grilled mushrooms and onions to the burger. The mushrooms were fresh (some places used canned - ick!) and the fried were really good. Wonderful service too.
Great food, ok prices.  Great place to go for brunch and dinner.  Dennis Rodman was sitting at the table next us during bears game once.  I took photos like a creeper.

I've returned to Northside twice since I left the review below. It was better.  The drinks are good and fair/typical prices. The food is good bar food.  My only complaint remains the service. It's okay- but quite slow and it seems as if they waitresses/hostess despise serving their customers. I know being excited to work all day is hard work, but a smile would help just a little :)

The food here was delicious. The beer selection was superb. The only thing that killed the experience was the fact that our server treated us as though we were an inconvenience to her night. She was annoyed the entire time we were there besides when she dropped off the check with a big smile. We got better service from the bus boy who actually ended up ringing in a round of drinks for us when our server was no where to be found.  On top of this, I opened a tab when we were waiting for our table (We waited about 30 minutes. Not bad.) and after our meal I went to the bar to close it. The bartender ended up closing my tab with someone else's card and was not phased when I corrected her. Oops. I'll be checking my account to make sure she didn't do that with my card and other tabs. Long story short, the food is awesome but don't go here if you expect equally as good service.

Before we went here, we read the reviews on Yelp and they were inconsistent.  Most seemed to praise the food, others hated the service.  I'm happy to say we experienced both good food and good service. We were going to see our son's band play at a venue down the street from Northside Bar and Grill.  We decided it was best to eat something first, so we scoured Yelp and and walked up and down several streets in Wicker Park looking for something simple.   When we came across Northside, we immediately saw people sitting in their beer garden, laughing and seemingly having a good time.  We decided to give it a go. We were seated immediately by a very friendly hostess.  Our server promptly came to the table and took our drink order - they have a fabulous menu of craft beers both on tap and in the bottle.  Their menu is not large, mainly bar food, but had a nice selection.  I ordered a hamburger with sweet potato fries; Kerrie ordered their pulled pork quesadillas.  I have to say that the food was very good. The server checked with us regularly.  She also had a new employee trailing with her.  I suppose this could have put her on her best behavior considering other reviews, but I did not see any of the poor service mentioned elsewhere and would definitely go to the Northside Bar and Grill again sometime.

I came to Northside in search of a great patio and they have the best I've seen so far in this area. My server was very friendly as was the owner and bartender. I needed my drink sweetened and they had no problem taking care of it. The martini I had was amazing. The music was a really good mix and no bubble gum stuff. Can't wait for my next visit!

Love the beer garden and the fact that rain doesn't shut it down, even chilly weather doesn't stop it. It's just a nice, comfortable area. The food is nothing exceptional, it's bar food, but it's not bad. The drinks are great and it's a good sports bar but. You'll catch me here in the summer a few times just for that outside area though.

Zero stars, really. Worst experience I've ever had at a bar for the attitude of the staff alone. I'd get better service at McDonalds. The server was rude, took 20 minutes to take our order or even acknowledge we were there- then another 20 to get the 4 bud lights. We ended up leaving it took so long. Hostess was rude as well. This place has great potential. Owners/managers- hire new people that actually want to work in the service industry and make money and don't suck. You lost a lot of money last night.

Northside is a great neighborhood bar.  It can get pretty crowded for big games an of course when the weather is nice outside the patio is hard to find a seat.  Solid drink offerings whether you're looking for the hard stuff or a beer.  I LOVE their turkey burger, which is served on a pretzel bun, made really well.  Definitely a great place to hit up if you're looking to go out in the area and want some pub grub before doing so.

After a years boycott, I was coaxed this evening into coming back. Considering it's in my neighborhood, boycotting Northside is actually kind of inconvenient. I put in for a table of two and sat at the bar a few feet from the hostesses stand. I was told it was going to  be a half hour wait. After 45 minutes I turned around to see the hostess seat two people who had just walked in. At this point I asked her if it was my turn to be seated, considering that I had asked for a seat 45 minutes prior and was still waiting. She defensively answered that she'd been looking for me when it was my turn, but couldn't find me. I comedically pointed to my bar seat four feet away and said "I'm sitting right here."  After being asked if I wanted to talk to the manager -no, I wanted food- I was introduced to the manager ten minutes later, who found us a table.  As my friend said "you were right to blackball this place".

Let's see.. what would you say about a place that has rude servers, bad burgers but is empty and has a fireplace on a winters night?   Really, both servers were rude and condescending, as if they had permission to be... blatant.  The place was DEAD and although my client and I were extremely polite and friendly, they were both "way too self important to be bothered with politeness".   The burger was at best a 7/10.. That's average.   PS- I rarely leave bad reviews

I've been a long time customer of the Northside.  I used to go there when they were located under the EL on webster.  Anyway, I still frequent the location on Damen when I'm craving a decent burger, great hummus and wings.  I also like the always changing layout and decor.  Keeps things interesting.  However, I went there this past week for an early lunch and some beers.  I was with my husband and we decided to split a burger and ordered a pitcher of miller lite.  finished our food and drinks.  Asked for the bill, only to find out our bill was just under $35.00.  WHAT?  I knew they raised their prices, but...$18.00 for a pitcher of Miller Light?  COME ON!  We are not New York or Miami.  Need less to say, we will not be frequenting the NS anytime soon.  I'm bummed and feel jiped.  (I guess the needless and ever changing decor needs to be paid somehow, right?
Good place.  Good beer and good social atmosphere.  Parking is very hard though and the balance between bar and restaurant is not very good.  Overall though I like coming to this place.

So, so nice on the inside but the food really isn't that good. Really close to my house so we've gone multiple times and I'm never impressed with the food. It's not bad, it's just not exciting or fun to eat. I can't wait until summer though, their patio looks fun.

My review is only based on a daytime, football watching experience, but it was exceptional. We sat in the back room and I already can't wait to come back here in the summer! The atmosphere in the current season is warm and comfortable, we sat at a low table right next to a fireplace. I can understand their rationale, but the only downside was that the volume on the TVs was off in this large front room. However, the volume was on in the back room and there were plenty of TVs, allowing everyone to watch whatever game they wanted.  They have a really extensive beer list and a large menu. We ended up ordering the nachos with chicken, which were fantastic and massive. The four of us could barely finish them. We also ordered some wings which were also massive and not lacking in buffalo sauce. I definitely recommend both of these if you're looking for apps. Between the nachos and wings, the four of us were all full, but I can't wait to go back and try some more menu items!

Ok, let's get this out of the way, the place looks great. Now onto the review. I was there last week and had the turkey burger.  This is no hyperbole to state I've had better turkey burgers at a middle school cafeteria lunch. Again, that is no hyperbole. And the service is really gone down

I've only been a few times but I've enjoyed myself each time. I really like the atmosphere but the service has been slower each visit. Nice mixed crowd of customers, too. The food is typical bar fare - limited menu, large portions, but not particularly delicious. The last couple of times I've been there the food has really been inferior, so much so that I've changed my rating from 3 to 2 stars. The beer isn't all that cold, either, which continues to strike me as a bit odd.  There are too many great places to eat in the Wicker Park/Bucktown area to bother going back to Northside Bar & Grill unless they really step up their game.

I've been dining at this place since 04.  It's pretty consistent.  Good burgers and excellent wings.  Recently went there with my family and in laws.  we received very good attention and food; everyone was pleased.  Summer in the beer garden is great stuff.

This place rocks! I adore this place so much. They have the best NACHOS and drinks, EVER. I also met the LOML (Love Of My Life) here as well. I loooove this spot!!!!!! If you want to be cool - go here. If you like nachos - go here. Freaking amazing!!!!!!

The 5 stars is for Emily R who was such a great waitress!  She was very attentive and accommodating for our large group. Emily was kind compared to some goon in a red shirt who seemed to be a manager.  If you try to stay after they tell you to get out and the bouncer will threaten to fart on you.

I'll echo what other's have said about the service here - overall it sucks.  It ranges from acceptable to terrible.   I've visited several times and have never been terribly impressed with any aspect of Northside.  They have good beer on tap with a decent selection of brews; last time I was there however, the waitress brought out two beers for my friend and I and said "I don't know which one's which.  I think that's right, you'll have to figure it out."  WTF?  Seriously?   The food is better than your average bar food.  Not great, not terrible, but OK.  The burgers and wraps are pretty good and their menu has a good amount of "American fare" variety to it.   The patio is nice on summer evenings to grab a beer and bite to eat - you'll just have to deal with the lazy, uninterested wait staff (or "how not to get a 20%+ tip").

Went here for a Brunch on Sunday, the brunch menu was small but what I had was good. The other people in my party ordered burgers which were quite good and everyone enjoyed. Not a fan of the chicken tenders but it may just be their style. The waitress was nice and patient with my parents who were with me as well.

I really like this place. The prices are good. The service is good the food is good and there is plenty of room so we always seem to get a table. I usually order a burger  and a draft. They have recently changed from full sized English Pint glasses to a soda fountain style glass which looks like it might be a couple ounces shy of a pint. Let's hope this isn't a new trend that takes us back to the days of thick hollow bottom ripoff  beer mugs.

The Northside Bar & Grill is a Wicker Park neighborhood bar with a good beer selection and outstanding courtyard and atrium..  The food is better than average bar food, but nothing special.  You can't beat the garden and atrium.  Fun place, friendly staff and partrons.

Came around here for lunch because Bongo Room had a ridiculous wait and Caffe de Luca turned into some weird grass-fed cafe (WEEP!). Northside has a very nice patio, with a pretty typical pub menu of fish&chips, brats, burgers, salads, etc. Nothing too remarkable about the place and service was pretty slow despite the place being next to empty.  Also, not to be picky but....I ordered a Diet Coke and ended up with an extremely flat Diet Pepsi. Next time, I'd rather get a heads up on drink selections so I can avoid the watery yet sadly syrupy mess. I'll probably come back at night to take advantage of the sweet patio and drink specials, but no more lunches here for me.

Went here for lunch on a recommendation from a former Chicagian.  We loved the indoor-outdoor seating set up, as it was warm and welcoming, and allowed for good people watching.The menu was not extensive, but had your standard fare. I chose a side salad with dijon dressing and the pork bbq quesadillas, and Jeff got a burger. They had a nice beer list, so I also got a Brooklyn Summer Ale.  Our food came out promptly, and everything was A-OK. Nothing spectacular, but we weren't looking for the best meal of our lives, just a good lunch in a relaxing environment, and that is exactly what we got.

This is a very cool place.  The only downside is it is ALWAYS packed.   There is a cool patio area with lots of comfy outdoor seating.  There is a great selection of beer and the food is very good.   Definitely try this place out.

I dig the secret size of this bar in Wicker Park. The giant patio is great for any time, summer or winter, and the beer selection is nice as well. The few times I've been the DJ spins some great music as well. I've only eaten one thing, the beef nachos, and they were great after a few rounds of drinks. Good times every time I've gone.

It took or ever to get a beer even though it was not that busy.  Sitting in outside area is really nice though.  Waitress did not come back to check on us once after we got our food until long after we were done.   Poor service. Food is pretty good though. Had a hamburger and friend had pulled pork quesadillas.  Their fish and chips is pretty good too.

My husband and I went to this place, we loved the patio, the service was good, beer list very impressive but both of us had heartburn the same night and diarrhea the next day. not worth it. Good place for drinks but the food was really bad, the burger seemed like a pre-cooked frozen. I would go there for drinks with friends but definitely not eat there next time, I saw some other reviews later of people saying they had stomach upset after going there, don't eat there!

This is a good place to go for a chill time with a group of friends. It's a decent size during dinner time and not overly crowded. I went for dinner and to watch the Heat vs. Celtics game 7 around 7ish and it wasn't that crowded. We got a high table in the back. Food is decent...nothing exceptional a tiny bit overpriced. There's also a pool table in the back. $1 per game. Lots of flat screens for sports watching. Wait was good; she always came to check on us to see if we were okay. It's possible to split the bill. Also have a patio area.

My husband and I stopped in on a beautiful Saturday afternoon to enjoy some nachos and drinks. We loved the open air effect! After thoroughly,  enjoying the nachos...which I am a bit of connoisseur in my pregnant state! We finished up our delicious drinks, and headed to a party out of town. After I was quite a ways out of town, I realized I had left my "favorite, favorite" little hoody in the bar. I called up and Chris the manager couldn't have been more kind and understanding about a "favorite, favorite" hoody, and agreed to priority mail it, at no charge, out to me so I wouldn't have to make arrangements to come back to the city. NOW that's truly service!

Excellent food. TERRIBLE SERVICE!! I don't think I'd go back!  for any one going PAY CASH!! the waitress we had couldn't seem to get swiping the cards and the amounts WITH the names for the cards correct!  The Manager didn't make us feel like we should return either! all she has to do is LISTEN to the customer and what they're saying instead of trying to make an excuse for the staff!  Listening goes a very long way!!!

Northside was a pleasant surprise - their beer list is surprisingly well stocked with quality options (Three Philosophers...yuuuuuum). Friendly staff, decent seating (both inside and out), and the food (while not exceptional) offers standard bar food that certainly makes a decent evening meal. I opted for the turkey burger with sweet potato fries. The fries were a bit squishy, but the burger was served on a nicely toasted pretzel roll.  Beer was a little pricey, but, it's worth it when it's good. The location of this bar is pretty fantastic, and if you're looking for a big screen TV to stare at all night, this might be your place.

I had an ex-girlfriend who really enjoyed going here, but I never went with her. I guess the name just never appealed to me. I finally got the chance to check it out this past Friday evening after devouring pizza @ Piece. We snagged a nice 4 seater in the middle area where I was at an angle to wactch the Bulls get smacked by the 76ers on 2 different TVs Our waitress was nice as she made sure we left out that spot drunk than a MF. 3 Makers & Diets got me passed where I needed and wanted to be. They played a nice mixture of hip hop, pop, r&b and classic rock. They also played some Beastie Boys joints as this was the day that MCAs passing was announced.  I like this place as it is a lot cozier and chill than most of the bars in the Bucktown area....shame on me for ever doubting the coolness of this place.

Nice low key place in Wicker Park with a beautiful outdoor patio.  Stopped here for some nosh and drinks one Friday night and had a great time.  The music wasn't too loud where we had to scream to talk to each other and the nachos we shared were excellent.   Is it my go-to place? No, but it is worthy of a stop in.

3.5 this is a great neighborhood bar!  i've been here multiple times, but never really had anything to report til now. it was a sunday when it was 65 and sunny, which always urges white folk to eat outdoors.  i am not white (but pretty much) so i was all over this joint.   their patio is pretty sweet.  there's patio seating, but also a dining area open to the outdoors.  we sat on a couch made of wicker.  cool. order a mimosa (i think there was a spesh) and it came along side those little black champagne bottles, which i am a sucker for.  my man orders a beer.  we are ready to order.  we wait.  and wait.  finally... oops, nope.  okay, now. she takes our order, crabbily, without writing it down.  i get sorta specific:  "i'll have the chicken chopped salad, feta instead of blue cheese, and a side of sweet pot fries."  no big, right?  he orders the steak sandwich.  and we'd like more drinks please.   i bet $5 that she'll get the order wrong one way or another. wait. wait. wait. here are your drinks.  sip.  wait, this is CIDER and not another beer. sigh. here comes our order and the correct beer!  finally!  yum!   where are our fries? wait wait.  here.  these are not sweet potato fries. wait here, finally! i won my $5.   so.  lots of waiting.  i dont think our server was all there, obvi.  the food was good though.   i would definitely come back.  just not to that server.

Came here lastnight with some friends and we had a good time. They have a pretty nice patio and our server was always there when we needed her but not pushy at all.  I had the tuna steak wrap  with sweet fries, which was amazing I couldnt stop eating it. They had a pretty good beer list too. I'll definitely be back.

This place is... meehhh. I always walk by it and it always looks packed, so i figured it must be good. I think this is mostly because they have good outside space on Damen. Food - nothing impressive. I tried Nachos which seem to be pretty popular here, and Nicoise salad. Nachos are hard to mess up and salad- well .. salad... entirely too much dressing, they weren't sure which greens go on it so they tossed arugula, spinach.... and romaine(?) weirdest combo ever , and steak tomatoes, which were the biggest things on the plate ( because the salmon that they offer was TINY), were so wilted that it had be at least 3 days ago when they cut them. Beer list is above ave. and prices arent ridiculous. Wait staff is nice but they def. have issues with staffing ( i mean UNDERstaffing) when it's warm out.  Overall, if you want some nachos and a cold beer on a nice patio ( and willing to wait 2 hrs for it) , then this could be your place.

Weird, I cant believe I havent written a review on this place? I probably come here at at least 2-3 times a month if not more. Its super convenient on Damen, has great wine prices and great food. Yeah, the service can be somewhat lacking depending on when you go in, but we're usually so deep in convo we don't notice. I've tried a lot of things on their menu, and the nachos probably stand out the most as does the Nicoise salad...its my go to when we go there for dinner. The falafel wrap is super good as is their lox and bagel. Their outdoor patio during summerI dont think there's is really anything bad about this place. Check it out for sure!
Like most, I think this place is pretty meh.  It gets the job done when the other places are too crowded.

Not a bad place, but only marred by one issue.  If you are seeking a good place to grab some friends and have some drinks and dinner, it's a good place.  You should find yourself comfortable here as it's not obnoxious like many other places.  The service was rather quick with getting eveything in time, but could probably work on learning how to correct problems better.  The food was ok.  I liked the sweet potato fries, the hummus was fine and probably would get them again.  However, I was highly disappointed with the burger.  The menu states that the burgers will be made "medium" unless otherwise noted.  I made sure to state "well done" and even repeated myself.  I don't like burgers medium.  Needless, it came back rare. I was hungry, annoyed and not wanting to wait for them to send it back and wait...again!  The waitress new I was annoyed and offered to put that burger that I had halfway eaten back on the grill.  I find that unsanitary and rather gross that I might be eating off a grill of other people's half eaten food.  Gross.  I also told her I wasn't interested in waiting and will "just deal with it."  Now. knowing that I was annoyed, most people would have knocked off some of the drinks or even the burger itself to make sure the customer leaves happy.  Hmmm, not this place.   Because of this, I can't say I'm rushing to go back.  The bourbons were made right, so I'll go back for the drinks and just bypass on the food.

I've been here a few times using my or a friend's Member Card from WTTW. It's good for two for one entrees. In the summer there is a nice "patio" type area and in the winter they make it cozy. I've had a few decent sandwiches and wraps. I've had bad sangria here. I'll be back if we're using the Member Card.
