This bar is okay.  I didn't eat any food, but I was not too big a fan of the ambiance, or the beer list.  The beer list was rather limited.  Overall, I was not too impressed.

Pretty nice beer selection. Great spot to watch Sports. Lot's of TV's and they will make every effort to accommodate you if your sport is not on. Bartenders are always cool. Food is not bad either but I miss the old food menu. :) Well run atmosphere. I recommend.

Loved the food...the tuna wrap was really good. The waitress was prompt and made sure everything was ok with my table's order and if we needed anything else.  Overall, the service was good. Liked the ambiance and the fire place. Defiantly will be heading back here.
Love the fireplaces and the glass roof.  Waitress was prompt and expedited our food so we could eat and make appointment.

I ate here on a weekday with 2 of my girlfriends and our 3 kids, all under the age of 1. The decor is cute, it's comfortable and casual, but still nicely decorated. I had the salmon special, which came with green beans and potatoes. My son and I both enjoyed it; it was tasty but not too heavy, even with the small amount of cream sauce, and the salmon was cooked nicely. The special was either $10 or $12, I can't remember which, but it wasn't  pricey and the portion was generous. The wait staff were very nice, but they seemed a little confused that  children were there. I wouldn't say it was especially kid friendly, but it wasn't "anti children" either. We appreciated the stroller "parking" in the hallway, we fit our 3 strollers there no problem. For any parents looking to venture here with kids, the stroller space is a plus, and they do have high chairs, but no changing table in the bathrooms. However, it gives you an added excuse to go across the street to Psycho Baby and use theirs (and shop!)  All in all, i'd definitely be back. I like the shopping near by and the neighborhood, and its about a block from the Damen blue line stop, and steps from the North Ave bus, which is always a plus!
$7.00 mamosas are good on sundays. The scene is nice when they retract the roof. I like this place obviously. Farvorite bar lots of tv's

Came here to watch a Bears game (against the Lions...not a great night). I ordered a burger as that's my usual Dukan Diet choice at bars. It was pretty decent. I think our waitress was training another girl and she seemed pretty lost. She forgot some drinks and wasn't aware of some of the basic choices on the menu. As a result, service was a bit slow. Still I do like the "outdoor" section. It was warm and cozy during the game. We had plenty of room for our whole group and prices are pretty decent. Just an average A-OK bar altogether.

It has been a few years since I have dined/imbibed at Northside, since I moved away from the neighborhood.  Recently I returned for some food and drink and they place has really changed.  The food and beer menus have expanded and they have a decent amount of specials (both food and cocktails) that change monthly.   The space is big but cozy, and there are two bars.  The times I have been the waitresses have been just ok in my opinion, as far as friendly/helpful/attentive go... but that could just be coincidence.   Great for simple but tasty bar food and not too loud to chat with your friends.  I'll be back.

So I was here on Friday and and my experience was ok.  I came here one other time before and I thought it was worth 5 stars.  So what happened for the loss of two stars?  Well first, I was a little disappointed because the service was slow.  I can understand that it's a Friday night and service is delayed, but I've been to more crowded places and service was not that slow.  Second, I'm pretty sure the music at the Northside Bar and Grill was just as loud as the music at Sound Bar.  So that led to a rather annoying experience when I just gave up on conversation because I couldn't hear myself.  I'd still go back, but hopefully they change their efficiency and volume.

Don't you hate it when a potentially good friend (bar) has nothing but idiots (staff) and potential douche bags (patrons) surrounding them. Like they have the POTENTIAL to be great. It's kind of how I feel about Northside B&G. It's all there, nice patio, good looking looking bar, food is nice (I guess pending what you have according to others), and maybe I was too harsh to say that the staff are a bunch of idiots because they were really nice just not too bright (they're young). Also when I talked about the patrons, it was more of a feeling. I was there early but as it got later people started to get louder and I heard a view dumb asses in the crowd plus the music started to get louder too, that's when I left. As for the food issues, I had none. The hummus was great and the turkey burger on a pretzel roll was one of the best I've eaten. Sweet potato fries need some work but overall very nice. Too bad, so much potential.

My friends couldn't stop raving about this place, so the roomie and I finally decided to stop by and try it out. The set-up of the place is great with the outdoor patio and the bar inside. I'm not sure if the patio stays open for the winter, but I'm sure they could make it work with heaters.  They have a lot of options on the menu, and some seasonal dishes. The rotini pasta salad with chicken is amazing, and big enough to take home for leftovers. I've also had the chicken tenders and the chicken skewers, which were both awesome as well. Theres a huge drink menu with a beer of the month. Yay, I love this place!

Dear Mister and Misses Northside, the lack of stars is based solely on recent events....like removal of the best-selling items from the menu (goodbye bacon blue-cheese burger, you will be missed), removal of the best-liked staff from your employ, and addition of DJ's on nights when your entire clientele is there to relax, have a conversation and catch a game.   I am sure in time your brilliant master plan will be revealed for those of us that spend our hard-earned money there to be awed and inspired by, and this will all make sense.  In the mean time I'll be sitting across the street at Cans, drinking crappy beer and salty tears, eating crappy food, and waiting for the remedy revealed.

Used to LOVE Northside. It's one of the few places I actually CRAVED a salad from. The grilled chicken cesar salad was delicious but the last few times I've gone I've been so disappointed. The salad completely changed. too bad, it used to be one of my fave spots.

The food was amazing. I had the falafal wrap with the veggies and my husband ordered the chicken pesto sandwich. Everyone else at the table enjoyed their meals as well. The only reason I am not giving Northside 5 stars is because the waitress was rude when I ordered my wrap. I asked to switch out the Tahini sauce that comes with the wrap for the Taziki sauce. She asked if I was being funny by pronouncing the names wrong. Then told me they were the same sauce. I was completely offended and explained to her that they are in fact two different sauces. She apologized, but I found her initial reaction completey unprofessional for someone that works with people for a living.

A nice looking bar and I am surprised I don't here more about this. This is the place for sports and they have like two bars including a lounge area in the back. The bartenders were magnificent and the two of them moved quickly what was a packed labor day crowd. They spent some money making this place look nice but not intimidating for the casual bar goer.

What a shame... great location, awesome outdoor patio, and mediocre everything else. I've lived in the Bucktown for 6+ years, and have tried Northside too many times.  The appeal of the open air seating and location keep me regrettably giving it one too many chances. Service is very slow and impersonal, food is fair, and beverages are unimaginative and bland. Cool to sit outside once, just don't expect much else

When I can convince friends to actually come to my neighborhood for drinks, Northside is my number one go to. Delicious craft beers at good prices ($5 Bells Two Hearted?  Yes, please.)    Maybe my favorite nachos in the city. The place will get packed on a Friday or Saturday night, but there always seems to be a good mix of people (not too yupstery or too hipstery) and it's usually not unbearably loud. My kind of bar.
Decent selection of beer and food. Can get a little loud, but the staff is nice to knock it down to 11.

The ambience is super chill.  I love it, I think it'll be our place to go in the winter time.  They had a good selection of taps & whiskey at a reasonable price.  Food was average, but reasonably priced, I'm rating this place as a bar though.  The only downside is the service.  Both times when I went in I was practically ignored for the first 10-20 minutes, and given slow service afterwards.  So its a great place if you're going to chill, not a place to pop in and out quickly.

Stopped in here the other night with a couple people on a mini-barcrawl across Bucktown and had no problem getting a table and a few drink specials. They're outside-but-still-kind-of-inside area is neat and they played both old Jay-Z and James Brown while we were there. They also have delicious nachos.

I didn't have their food so this review is for a typical saturday night spot. ( I will go back for food and update later!) The place (in the spring/summer) is fun. Great Great beer garden/front patio. It is super fun to sit on the outdoor bar. For a Saturday night it took quite some time to jump on a table. The crowd was a loud one but who isn't on a Saturday?  Drinks were average city priced but not as strong as some of their neighboring bars. Which is probably why we ended up leaving. If you are sitting inside the place is just not as fun.  3 stars for the atmosphere of the place...but that is it.

Pretty good bar. Decent tap selection. The wait staff can take awhile on busy nights, you are likely going to get better/faster service if you go directly to the bar. Best part about this bar seems to be the patio and the ability for large groups to come and hang with ease.

What you want from your local watering hole. When you walk in, you are greeted by an actual fireplace which is definitely something you want after roaming around the streets of Chicago at night! Friendly staff, bounced and decent priced drinks. Decent nachos too! Id call it a good starting point as you stumble across Damen

I need to start this review off by saying that I have a very laid-back and low-key family.  We're from Iowa; we don't need a lot of attention or over the top service to enjoy ourselves. That being said, Northside Bar and Grill was terrible. If I could give it negative stars I would.  I will start with the one redeeming quality of the restaurant and that would be it is really beautiful inside. I love the greenhouse look of it, minus the fact that the roof was leaking. Yes, that's right, the roof was leaking on myself and family during the meal. We pointed it out the waitress she said she was sorry and would be right back. She brought her manager out with her who instead of apologizing or moving us (the restaurant was half full) he told us that the roof had been leaking in that spot for twenty years and that's just the way it is. Um, ok, why not fix it? He basically told us to suck it up.  Personally, if it had been my restaurant I would have been mortified. I also don't think that the roof has been leaking for twenty years. This is Chicago; I have a hard time believing that for twenty years a roof that has leaked has not been fixed between the fifty feet of snow and rain that comes down each year. Also, Mr. Manager, don't tell us to just deal with it, I can deal with a lot of things, but getting rained on inside is not one of them. Basically his approach to the whole thing pissed me off, I don't think I'm being crazy by complaining about getting rained on. The food wasn't bad, however the waitress screwed up two of our orders (out of five). She messed up my brother's order by putting mushrooms and onions on it, when he asked for them to not be included. She didn't put my order in so I had to wait after everyone else was served. I should note that she blamed someone else for her mistakes, again not apology. At the end of service we were visibly annoyed. I'm upset that the service is so bad, because the restaurant itself is very nice, however between the constant mistakes of the wait staff and the manager who has clearly never heard the phrase, "the customer is always right", I don't think I will be returning.

I am big fan of Logan Bar and since this place looks exactly like it I figured they must be owned by the same people so I wanted to give it a try.  I only went for a few beers but I an definitely going back again.  The service was good.  Our server was so friendly.  They also have a good beer selection. Great Lakes, Bells, Goose, Firestone Walker.  Delicious. Lastly, the patio is phenominal.  It is so great because you aren't sitting on the street in the noise and crowd of Damen.  You are in the restaurant but it is all open to the breeze.

Cool bar with a really nice patio and a laid back atmosphere. Along those lines, there's a couple pool tables in the back. There's tons of TV's around, a decent beer selection, and a very attentive staff. I walked in with my Red Wings sweatshirt with Bulls and Cubs games playing everywhere. The host came by with a remote and asked if I wanted the channel changed to the Wings game. Um, what is "yes" sir? I didn't even need to ask. That's huge. It can get pretty loud and packed on Friday and Saturday nights, but at least I've never run into a douche bag crowd there.

Came back here for a second chance. The food was just as good as before. It was A LOT busier this time around. Weird how the service was better than the last time I came here when the place was empty huh? My friend was right. The nachos are "FIRE!!!!!!!!" When we got our nachos I noticed a neighboring table order it after taking a peek at ours. Seriously, order them. You'll regret it if you don't! I can't remember what I ordered, but I know I liked it. Boyfriend liked his food too! My Vanilla and Diet Coke was made perfectly! Strong enough for the price. The bartender was really nice. Hostess was really nice. Waitress was nice, too! I'll definitely be back in the Summer.

We've been going here forever.  Since before the Wicker Park boom.  We were happy to be back today.  Found a great beer on tap, split a variety of appetizers (nachos, pizza and calamari) and they were good!  Didn't get to take advantage of the beer garden since winter won't seem to end this year, but really enjoyed it anyway...glad a piece of the 'vintage' Wicker Park stuck around.
Had an absolutely fantastic pork chop and mustard sandwich.  Service not so good tonight but the food made up for it.

So, we go to Northside all the time. It is a great place for drinks with friends, especially in the summer, they have a great outdoor area. The food sucks though. I hate to be so harsh, but every time I go I am always thinking, oh the food isn't that bad, then we eat and it really is. I could probably make better food. I am hoping the owners read this and get a new chef! Because I love to hang out there.  We used to live next to Logan Bar and Grill, it is an identical menu and is just as disappointing, but a great place to hang out. They had a pulled pork special once with a pretzel roll. It was awesome, of course they took it off the menu. What gives? They need an entire new menu. It is weird because they don't do standard bar food, like a bunch of fried stuff would even be better than their menu.  I love you Northside as a hangout, get a new menu:)

I went here for lunch during my Chicago trip.  My salad was delicious , the atmosphere for cool, and the service was good.  No complaints and I would have no problem venturing here again during my next trip.

This is one of my favorite Wicker Park spots. I think the food is tasty and I like the outdoor/indoor feeling of the patio. It's been crowded late night Fridays, so I tend to go on Sunday afternoons. The bleu cheese burger's are really good and they have some interesting drinks, including a ginger vodka drink.  The staff is LACKING. I can't say that I have ever received truly good service here. It's alway just been o.k. The food and the ambiance have made up for the latter. Parking hasn't ever been too difficult for me, but if you can walk or catch the blue line there, I'd suggest not driving.

A great neighborhood place... well... it COULD be great... Everything about this place is seriously one notch away from being such a gem in Bucktown.  Not sure if the place is just getting tired or if this is how it's always been. Food - OK, but could be better.  We stayed to safe things like Nachos, Tomato Soup and Burgers as we heard not to get too adventurous from friends.  Some of the items on the menu are trying too hard.  You are a bar, give me straight chicken fingers, not weirdo chicken fingers. Drinks - OK, but could be better.  Soda and Tonic made drinks taste like their gun lines needed to be cleaned.  It just tasted like something was off... same thing with the beer on tap.  My Blue Moon tasted like yesterday's Miller Lite... Service, Not OK, needs to be a lot better.  Had 5 people at our table and each one of use was looking around on more than one occasion for another drink, to order food or even just for water. Atmosphere, GREAT!  Watched the Bears playoff game here, the game we won convincingly, not lost convincingly. Plenty of TV's, plenty of seating if you got there early, this is the one thing I can't complain about... Overall, I feel like for the area this place resides, I would just expect more and I know a lot of other people who feel the same way. I am sure this place won't improve and will be around forever, but just throwing out my 2 cents... Also, Good for Kids is a question below here in the comment box and I was shocked to see people bringing kids in for a binge drinking football game event...  Watch the game at home people... I want to be able to swear at the TV and jump up and down if the Bears score, not worry about your napping baby or the carefully placed baby carrier on a chair... idiots. CP

We ended up here after having drinks elsewhere and wanting something light to eat, and this was the first place we found without a wait. No wait and available tables at 9pm on a Friday night? That should have been my first clue. Hmmm, let's see here:  - Terrible, slow service.  - It took our server a good ten minutes to greet us, then another five to find us menus.  - By this point it was so bad we debated bailing before our drinks made it to our table. We should have - we had plenty of time, because did I mention service was slow?  - When I did get my drink it was completely watered down.  - Food options are not great. When my friend and I decided to split the mini angus burger, I guess I was expecting something that didn't resemble a McDonald's hamburger in look and taste. The "natural" fries were actually good though, so I will give them credit for that. (And no trans fat!)  - They offer unhealthy options with sandwiches disguised as healthy options. Their veggie choices last night SOUNDED healthy, but if you stopped and thought about it they weren't because most of them were coated with a glaze that equaled sugar, sugar, sugar.  - They have plenty of TV's tuned to various things, so that's a plus. The TV in my line of vision played the Men's Shake Weight commercial at least 10 times, and I couldn't stop laughing. If you haven't seen it, behold: youtube.com/watch?v=xbsS…  - The crowd is... not my scene. Not a cute boy in sight. Douchebaggery at its finest. I'll pass.  - Loud music, and not even good music. They'd get a pass on the loud music if it was at least half good, but nope. In conclusion, this bar was everything I hate about the bar scene in Wicker Park.

This place is one of the best bar/grills I have been to in some time. The exterior is awesome but the inside is even better. While meeting a bunch of old college friends this place was able to accommodate a large group of individuals who all had multiple orders and requests.  Prices weren't bad and the food was great. Chips and salsa were better then most Mexican restaurants.

I live right by this bar/grill and have been wanting to try it due to the inviting look from the outside.  The interior/exterior is really nice.  I like all the lights and the couches in the patio area.  It's heated in the fall so it's still pleasant to sit outside.  It's much bigger than it looks with a mishmash of high tops and booths.   I go there after work to play pool sometimes and it's never crowded and the table always seems to be open.  The prices are reasonable and the servers are polite if not a bit inattentive.   The reason this place makes 4 stars for me is their music selection.  They always play Black Keys, Radiohead, Kings of Leon, etc.  I love it.  So rare to hear good music in a bar these days.
One of my favorite bars to just chill and watch football games. I don't know how much things cost cuz I just go nuts when I get here and have lots of beer and some good apps. So that's it...go there.
this place was ok went there with my friends. love the mytouchtunes jukebox

Not many hipsters or pretension here, just lots of big screen tv's, domestic draft specials and typical American fare. Nachos, burgers and Miller Lite are the norm.  So why go to Northside as opposed to any of the sports bars on the actual North side of Chicago? One killer patio in a neighborhood mostly bereft of large patio seating (Big Star doesn't count to me on account of the long wait). In warmer months you can sun yourself in the open air patio, then in the winter they close the patio up so it's heated but you still get that feeling of sitting outside.  Nothing particularly special about Northside, but that patio will keep me coming back.

Been here a few times.  Tonight was the first time I had an item of the menu that really wowed me (Black and Bleu burger - it was pretty good for a bar burger).  Pretty good beer garden.  Beer selection isn't bad, but then again most places like this in the city have a selection that could equal NSB&G's or if not top it.  Points off for running out of 3 Floyd's Gumball Head.  That's just poor form.  TL;DR:  Fairly common bar food and beer selection with better than average beer garden.  If you're looking to just get by on average for what can be found else where on any occasion you won't go wrong.  If you're looking to knock the socks off a date and really impress someone, this really isn't your place.

It's a great spot in the neighborhood. There is enough room, enough seating and it's great when then open it up for the summertime. The service is friendly. Where they lose a star is with the food. It's pretty average and a little overpriced for what they are offering. All in all though, I enjoyed frequenting this place on a regular basis.

We didn't have any of the service problems people have complained about: a friendly waitress served our drinks and checked in regularly, with no apparent frustration that we weren't eating. Nice spot in the outdoor garden, a decent Oktoberfest beer special. All in all, a perfectly decent spot that got the job done.

Got a personal message from the owners apologizing for my negative experience, so we went back recently and things were somewhat better service-wise. The food is great, so if they ever get it together this could be a regular destination for me.

I had lunch here with some work peeps and thought it was interesting - meaning not entirely the type of place I'd normally go to, but I still had a decent experience. We sat outside in the beer garden area, which was nice. I imagine it is pretty in the evening.  For a restaurant that was only one thirds full, our server took forever to take our order. It took even longer for our food to arrive! By the time we had gotten our food and paid the bill, we had been there for 90 minutes. I had the chopped chicken salad, and it was kind of boring. Eh. However, portion sizes here huge, and still left me with an afternoon food coma.  I probably will not return to the Northside unless I develop a love for beer or bland salads.
I was definitely wowed by the very cool patio area.  it is huge!  It's got a cool feel with trees and plants...almost made me feel like I was on vacation in Chicago.

I've been to Northside for brunch and late night for drinks.  The food is really good, but the service is somewhat slow.  Great crowd of people during evening hours.  Great place to go in the morning with a hangover for some bloody marys and breakfast.

I came here for lunch with a coworker and wasn't expecting much more than a standard bar lunch.  I was pleasantly surprised by the atmosphere which wasn't dark and musty like I was expecting thanks to a wall and ceiling of windows, which made the dining area light and airy.  The service was about what you'd expect from a bar like Northside (re: slow and disinterested). I had the tuna pita which turned out to be a mistake. The tuna was gray and incredibly dry (it was a tuna steak, but super thin-cut). The sweet potato fries were good, but there weren't many of them. My coworker got the fried fish sandwich, which looked MUCH better than mine. I'd stick with the fried foods at this place.  The experience wasn't memorable, though I sadly do remember the two gross businessmen sitting behind us having a too-loud conversation about all the women who wanted to sleep with them. Classy, guys.  I don't think I'll be heading back to Northside for food, even if I am in the area.

Stopped by Saturday for lunch with my husband and son.  It was a beautiful day and we sat in the atrium area.  Great atmosphere.  Food was good, better than regular bar food. My husband and I ordered a small burger which had nice flavor and the sweet potato fries were really good. My son ordered a pulled pork sandwich which was huge and he said it was very good.  The service was very very slow.  I think our waitress decided to take her lunch break while we were there. Also, when she refilled our sodas, she mixed up my husbands and sons.  My husband noticed this bc the straw was chewed at the end. UGH!

I have been here probably 5 or 6 times.  I've done lunch, dinner and just this Sunday, brunch.  I must say I wasn't that impressed with the food and haven't felt much better any of the other times either.  It's just middle of the road.  For a cold beer and basic burger it's just fine.  The place looks nice and the staff was pleasant but again....nothing to really right home about.

As I can see from other reviews, most people agree with me--there is a lack of good customer service.  Have never "yelped" before, but this experience was enough to set up a profile and create my first review!  :) Upon a recent visit, the server brought my mom's chicken sandwich to her and before setting it on the table, the cup of ranch dressing fell off the plate and all over my mom's lap, on her leg, and her foot...also all over the floor.  It took a good 5 or 10 minutes to clean it all up and about 15 minutes after it happened we had to ASK for them to have the floor wiped up.  When it happened the girl was apologetic and they brought a new cup of ranch.  After that, perhaps they were embarassed but the service went downhill (as if that was possible!) and they did not refill drinks or check on us at all. Having worked in the food industry myself, great service means checking on the table within 2 MINUTES after bringing the food!  Besides, there were NINE of us (= large amount of money being spent/potential for a great tip)....and despite what we all expected, when the bill came, they had still charged us for the sandwich!! I mean, really!!! Not that we couldn't afford the $11.50, but it was the principle of the matter.  I approached the girl and requested it to removed from the bill, which it was.  Overall, myself and the 8 people with me would probably not be likely to return.  In general, the food was okay. The service--very poor.

Plus: this is one of the few places to watch a game in the neighborhood, and the outdoor space is great. Minus: Generally, the service is like molasses in January.  These are not ambitious employees. The food isn't bad, but it isn't great.  The sweet potato fries are good, but the accompanying "sauces" listed with them on the menu are ketchup and ranch.  Really?

A frank analysis of Northside... LOVE: The patio in the summer Their black-bean chili Their chicken chopped salad Friday and Saturday nights - Great people watching from a table, lively by any of the bars Music selection - So random, but oh so good LIKE:  Specialty drinks - Limona Lisa, anyone? The crowd - Mid-to-late 20's, definitely good looking The space - Sit, stand, schmooze, play pool, whatever you want is cool DISLIKE: The waitresses - Seriously, they suck. In maybe the 50 times I've been here I've had good service three times.  The rest of the food - It used to be sooooo good. Now it's just sooooo mediocre. It's a total bummer. I keep going back mainly for drinking on the weekend or to sit on the patio in the summer. Considering I'm there about once a week, I just avoid the aspects I hate and Northside ends up being pretty enjoyable.

Outdoor area is really great- but the food is without flavor.  This is the last time I will ever eat here (I made this same pledge about 5yrs ago, forgot about it until we sat there- all of us complaining about the food). It's a rarity in Chicago where the food at such a long lasting establishment is that poorly thought out. Drinks + outdoors = good. Food inside or out = bad!!!

In a word.... lame. BAD service; slow as molasses and our server had a bit of an attitude problem.  I didn't have one but my friends commented that the margaritas were terrible and tasted like kool-aid. We were having to flag down our server to even think about getting another beer. When our food FINALLY arrived after what seemed like an eternity, all of our fries were cold. Kind of pathetic. Our various burgers/sandwiches were fine; nothing special but not bad.  I don't hang out in this neighborhood super often, and I def won't be heading back for this place anytime soon.

Good place to chill and have a beer and some chicken wings. Has a cute front patio with plenty of tables to sit. Music was good, they played a lot of the good old school music which made a more enjoyable crowd. Definitely would go back.

I wish I could give 4 stars for summer and 3 stars for winter. I love sitting outside here in the summer. They have a really nice outdoor seating area and the service is just as good as if you sat inside. The strawberry blondes are so, so good. Food is better than your average bar food. Their brunch is very good, too. The servers are nice and attentive and they play good music. This is a great neighborhood bar.

We were on our way to Bluebird for my weekly serving of garlic frites and flatbread and green beans when I decided, no, we would not be going to Bluebird tonight.  Instead, we walked down the street a bit and ended up at Northside, mostly because their outdoor area is a good size and looked really nice.  The inside is also cool because they have this peaked glass roof, almost like a greenhouse.   We sat outside and had great service.  I also had a really delicious glass of red - a Malbec that was $8, and the pour was very generous.  We split their hummus appetizer and tomato/mozzarella/goat cheese pizza - would definitely return for both.  Definitely a fun place to go!

For some reason I used to tolerate this place because they had a couple cool "rocker guy" bartenders.  They must've been canned and now I realize that it sucks in there.  Cookie-cutter bar atmosphere that essentially caters to frat boys and Trixies.  And hell, even if that IS your scene, I wouldn't want to go here because it seemingly lost all it's personality.   I remember the food being okay, but it's not worth seeking out.

I've been here a few times. Food is good, service is good. Outdoor seating is nice. Good burger and beer place but nothing really makes it stand out for me. It's a place I can trust to have good food but nothing magnificent or amazing. Still would recomment to any group or after work hangout party.

I've had the chance to eat at Northside several times when I lived in the area, and recently went there as a meeting place before my friends and I headed to dinner.  The food is standard bar nosh- nachos, wings, burgers, etc. It's pretty standard, and nothing too special. They have a large dining room that opens up to Damen. The beer selection is nothing to write home about. Great spot to meet friends when you're starting out your night. Not really good for much else.

STRAWBERRY BLONDES!!!! I can drink those all night long! Well worth the $8 I must say. Came here to watch the Hawks game and enjoyed myself. We decided to sit at the bar since there were open spots instead of waiting for a table. Good crowd and the bartender Shannon was pretty good. I felt bad  as she worked the bar and service line all night. I'm sure not too much fun when the place is packed on  Wed night  and Hawks fans.  Tried the nachos and happy we ordered extra guac. They were really good! I am sure we will all be back again soon now that the weather is nice and we can sit on the indoor/outdoor patio.

Main reason to go to this place is for the large open patio and the location. Food is edible but nothing to yelp about and the well drinks lacked a bit in the alcohol department so I switched to vodka on the rocks and axed the well drinks. My advice would be to use this place as a starter bar because of nice patio area and then go to a cheaper place to get buzzed. Probably a much better place to go for afternoon drinking in the summer.

It was gorgeous out last night and I left work wanting to sit outside and enjoy the awesome weather and a refreshing beverage. I headed to Wicker Park with a friend from work. The first place we tried had a really long wait so we moved onto the Northside Bar and Grill. I was not disappointed. We found a table very easily at the patio at the front of the bar. There's also a huge outdoor area to the side of the bar. We ordered chips and salsa and the wings (which were half off). Everything we ordered was delicious. There was tons of salsa with the chips and the wings seemed more baked instead of fried. I'd highly recommend checking out Northside on a nice summer night!
The place is huge and I personally like their inside patio. The food was okay. Came out pretty fast the wait stuff is pretty helpful. Parking can be hard to find in the afternoon.

I decided to pop my yelp cherry after a group of friends and I decided to stop at Northside for a few of our standard Thursday night beverages back in early April. I'm just now getting around to mopping up the collective cherry pulp and reviewing our experience. let me preface this review with the fact that I'd been to northside two times prior to our most recent visit.   the first time was for dinner with my wife (non-wife at the time) over a year ago.  we sat outside and enjoyed a few brews along with a grilled something and some fried something on the side.  it was good.  not great, but good. the second time was with my sister after a tuesday night white sox game.  this time we sat at the bar and proceed to kill brain cells. the most recent visit is the one I am reviewing.   my wife voted to 'go someplace with a beer garden' so that we could enjoy the pleasant spring evening.  we elected northside because it was fairly convenient for everyone to get to and it has a sizeable outdoor space.   so we get there before our friends and put our name in for a table.   northside immediately lost points because of a few crappy songs.  I honestly can't remember what they were, and I'm not going to just make something up, but it wasn't good. northside (and one of the bartenders) then proceeded to more than make up for the crappy music when they played a black keys track (off of chulahoma no less!) and I purchased a cane and ebel from a bartender in a black keys t-shirt. all the friends arrived and we were seated.  the waitress proceeded to screw up my friend's beer order twice.  he was ordering the cane and ebel and was receiving the special.  I can understand the mix-up the first time because the special was also a two brothers brew.  but the second time was a head scratcher.  I proceeded to order another cane and ebel and received the special.  she blamed the bartender.  I blame the flake in the purple hippie dress. now, for the money shot.  my wife ordered nachos.  we waited over an hour for these nachos.  upon being reminded of the nacho order the waitress brought over a cold plate of soggy chips and brown guacamole.  not kinda brown / kinda green.  brown.  100% brown.  the color of poo.  normal poo.  when asked to return the nachos it was clear that the waitress knew they weren't up to par... and yet, she served them! nachos went back, no replacement nachos required, bill requested.   the nachos were still on the bill.   the bill went back, nachos taken off.  the bill was paid and we left knowing we won't come back.   sure I had two positive experiences and one poor one.  but the positive experiences were in the OK range and the poor one was in the craptacular range.   northside gets two stars, one star without the black keys.  hippie waitress with gobs of personality gets zero.

DRINKS ARE TERRIBLE! I was there with friends the other night and was having fun until the bill came.We had been charged for a ton of drinks we drank which was fine but tell me how 3 girls can drink 32 drinks and walk out of there no problem. The drinks were so so weak and overpriced. The food was average and service wasn't great. I would not go there again and to anyone who wants to make sure you get your liquor on the rocks so you aren't getting overcharged for mixers.

I received a message from (I'm assuming) one of the owners of Northside, assuring me that the turkey they use is not frozen and explaining the reason for the switch from steak fries to shoe string fries (customers and staff were tired of the steak fries and they are now using a non-trans fat oil.)  I appreciate the message and the stride toward healthier food, but they don't change my desire for a delicious turkey burger and steak fries...or the slow service I received...or the cold food I ate. I'd say Northside's long-term success is mostly attributable to its location and patio, not the food, service, or stale draught beer.  Clean your taps, for crying out loud.

Disclaimer: I have been here a few times and never had an issue.  That said, last night I ordered a beer on tap.  It wasn't good.  I decided to try my luck with a different beer on tap and had the same issue.  Two for two.... bad beer that was flat and just didn't taste right. I do like that there are a couple different places to hang out in this bar, and all have slightly different feels.  We had sweet potato fries that were quite yummy.

been here at least 20 times.  It a good stand by pub grub in the hood.  The menu is a little short, but the burgers are great.  close to 4 stars but not quite.  lots of TVs and a good patio.  Much better option than Cans across the street, unless of course you are looking to get sloppy  Service is OK

So if I could give it 0 stars I would.  The service is crap!  I was there today around 1 p.m. with two friends and our first waitress had to close and we waited for the new waitress for 15 min to come to our table and finally I went to the bar to get a drink.  (she was wearing a pokadot dress...she sucks!)  As a waiter I know how hard it is to do the job, but she ignored us the whole time.  From the time our first waitress left till we left we were there 2 hours.  NO SERVICE!!!!   I overheard our waitress telling someone that by us going to the bar we were taking from her tips.  We wouldn't have done that if she introduced herself to us or served us a drink.  Whoever she is...she sucks!  I hope the manager reads this.
Great setup between the beer-garden and the inside. It's one of the better places to grab some drinks and just chill. The staff is hit or miss though that's why I only give it 3 stars.
great architecture and very light and airy inside. Food and service good but not spectacular

The thing about being a "yelper" is that when going out for drinks or whatever with people that don't yelp, they put alllll the pressure on you to pick a great place. Usually, I pick a tried and true to impress, but I wanted a spot close to the blue line with a decent special.  I took a deep breath, consulted all my resources, and picked Northside, primarily for their $3 Sierra Nevadas and $2 tacos on Monday nights. Good special means this chica will usually show up.  And show up we did. We weren't interested in trivia (another Monday night offer), but we did partake in the trivia taco special. For $2, you could get TWO tacos with your choice of meat (or veggies). Two tacos. I mean, they were no Las Traspasada tacos, but for $2, I say, "Doin' it." Same with the Sierra Nevada special.  On a Monday night, we had no trouble getting a table, the service was adequate, music seemed to be at the appropriate volume and the company was awesome, of course. Nothing goes better with cheap beer and tacos than a rousing discussion of "Bow Tie Joey,"  britneyspears.com  and a reminiscing bicker about who had to file that afternoon.*  Nothing unbelievably special, but I'd go back for the specials and for this allegedly great patio.  * This comment is alllll inside jokes for my fellow former clerks.  This yelp's for you.

Came here on a Wednesday night; wanted a quiet, but not dead, place to watch the Blackhawks and have draft beer.  Solid choice.  I agree with those commenting plus on the decor & lights; this place has character.   The fireplaces are awesome, although I would rather that it be spring (aka summer) and have the patio open.  Greenhouse-ish roof in the main area is awesome also.  Food was moderately priced, overall a great experience.

Yuk! Walked in, the place smelled like a morning-after on Bourbon Street, in New Orleans.... those who have been there know what I'm talking about.  Surprisingly, it was packed the day I went there.  I ordered their breakfast special.  They only serve eggs scrambled, which means they are pre-made hours ahead of time or they are the powdered kind.  The food was awful. Not to mentioned I got some rotten potatoes in my dish.... what is it with rotten potatoes these days?!  I've got several of them at different restaurants.  Anyway, to sum it up, save your yourself and go eat somewhere else.

cool bar, im likin the floor to ceiling windows that face the street.  a chill vibe here that keeps it real and allows for good conversation.  outside theres a patio that im sure is great in nicer weather.

How cute is this bar?! Twinkle lights wrapped around one of the bars, a pool table, fire places and trivia night Mondays! I'm sure I liked it a lot more since my team won trivia night (1st prize was $60 off your bar tab)...but this place was nice.  Trivia night was fun, moderately hard questions with a funny reader. The specials were good, the menu varied, and the atmosphere was cozy. The wine was a little sub par, but I had an enjoyable time!

I used to love this place when I lived in the neighborhood (10 years ago). Great location, great beer garden, nice pool room, good bar, and beautiful servers. I have nothing but fond memories from my many days and night at The Northside. I think I even took my wife on a date there early on. I'll have to revisit The Northside and post an updated review.

I really like Northside -- they have good food, a cute atmosphere, friendly staff and clean, well kept bathrooms. My favorite is their Chopped Chicken Salad -- it's awesome. I see now they have trivia on Mondays.  I'll definitely have to check that out sometime!

This place is just okay... i'd say the patio is cool and it's a good place to hang out with friends in the summer time, but otherwise it's nothing special...its your typical bar food , kinda bland andd not all that great. the service was nothing special either... just an alright place there are definitely better places in the neighborgood

Granted I might be biased because my old roommate works at Northside, but at the same time, that has allowed me many opportunities to dine and drink there.   Northside is a sports bar, so taking that into consideration, it's amazing.  There is a fireplace and huge outdoor patio that becomes an indoor patio in the winter.  The ambiance is wonderful, considering you're in a sports bar.  I consider them to have decent music selection.   The drinks: great sangria (not on the menu) and good beer selection.  I like my IPA's, and lately they have had 2 on draft at all times.  Can't recall all the beers they carry, but I have had Stella and lagunitas there. Food: the best nachos I've ever had.  I've had nachos at, I don't know, I can think of 10 different restaurants right now, and these are worth every calorie.  Not too cheesy, good salsa, great chips (house made), guac, sour cream, steak, just the right combinations of everything.  Also amazing food: hummus (house made and fresh).  I've had salads, soups, and sandwiches, and it's all been really good.   Service:  Well, Kim is a fantastic server.  I've had one bad server (Kim was off), and she's since been fired.   Finally, Northside honors the NPR Member Card.  So good for them and me.

Didn't try the food here but came in for a drink late night and although it felt good to stand next to the fireplace on a cold rainy night and momentarily enjoy the ski lodge feel of the place, it didn't have much more to offer than that. Service was so so. Crowd was frat boys and a few yuppies. Not my cup of tea.

Northside is your classic "North woods in a sports bar, yet vaguely classy" themed locale. It was ok. Atmosphere (described above) was pretty nice. Wood interior, dim lighting, and flat screen TVs visible from all angles. Service was kind of lame- We ordered main courses and one beer each, and this seemed to annoy the server as though this wasn't enough. Sorry I'm not getting plastered tonight- Don't get all huffy at us about it! Food was not my favorite, but maybe that's just based on what I got-- Salad with fried calamari.. I guess it sounded better on the menu at the time. The salad just wasn't very special and pretty much felt like they had taken bagged lettuce, threw on a few croutons and calamari and soaked it in italian dressing. Anyways, they seem to have a clientel who really likes this place, so I'll leave it to them. Just not my taste.

I've lived in Bucktown for almost two years and have been to Northside Bar well over 10 times for lunch and dinner.  I will agree that the beer garden area is pretty solid in the warmer months (the garden takes up almost half of the seating area in the bar) and it definitely has a cool, laid-back vibe to it. However, what I will point out is that pretty much every time that I've gone here the service has been TERRIBLE.  For the food being pretty much higher quality bar food (the specials are generally very appetizing) it took the waitress almost 15 minutes to even realize we were there...and this has happened on more than several occasions. Granted I think it's generally understaffed so I don't necessarily blame the waitress, but still very unpleasant if you want to keep the drinks a'flowing.  The food is good and I'll tag-along with friends, but I won't go out of my way.

We've been going to this bar a lot recently and really like it. It is a great place to watch a game because of all the TVs and they have a Golden Tee and pool table in the back. The two bars and tons of waitresses make it easy to get your food and drink. They have daily specials, but they aren't that well priced. The food is spectacular there. The burgers are great, but the Black Bean Chicken Chili is unbelievably good.  I think I am going to try to go here on Sunday to watch some football because hockey and baseball have been fun to watch.
Ooofa I stopped in on a cold day I had an Octoberfest Beer and bowl of minestrone.... Just like Nana used to make(the minestrone not the beer) Hats off to ya I'll be back!

We came here for the tv and the many football games on Sunday.  They have the Sunday ticket so there are more than just the local or big games being played - which was the #1 reason that our group had to come here.  We also came because there were tables still available and we could commandeer a tv or two  to put the top game on.  The 5 of us got two tabletops just by what would be the outdoor beer garden in nice weather.  It is a cute little laid-back place. Our server was prompt.  To celebrate the Bears winning, there was  a round of shots.  The waitress was accommodating to the different tastes since we all didn't quite agree on tequila.   The drinks were strong and tasty. The service was okay.  It took a while to get our Wing order in (which for wings they were good). Our chicken tenders were not so good - overly fried is the only description I can think of.   The good thing was the bill was not as damaging as it could have been.  Bottom line: We'd come for football and drinks, but if we want food, we will go elsewhere.

Came here last week and our server was a tad spacey. It took her about twenty minutes to bring us our drinks, even though there were only two of us. Then she walked away without asking to take our food order. We thought she was going to come right back but my husband finally had to asks the server next to us...long story short, our server just kinda kept forgetting we were there all together. I could understand if it was really busy or something, but there weren't that many people when we did eventually get our meal, it was good; a little better than your average bar fair perhaps.  Gonna give them the benefit of the doubt and just assume the server was having a bad day. We've all had them.  +1 star for the wonderful patio/beer garden.

We were looking for somewhere to go to watch the football game have a few beers and maybe shoot a round of Golden Tee. All three were accomplished at Northside Bar and Grill. The menu has changed since I was there, but the food was still pretty good. There are a variety of beers to choose from, and the service is always good.  I will always go back to Northside.

I've lived so close to this bar/grill for so long & have never been--how cold that be?  I'm sure glad that Amy H asked me to come meet her for an afternoon drink. They had a really nice, spacious beer garden. It is great because it is right off the sidewalk, yet you have great privacy.  Our service was decent. The food was good. Amy ordered a huge plate of rotini pasta, which looked like it had some sort of cheese & sun-dried tomatoes. Looked good! I on the other hand just had a dinner salad. It was good too, I liked the balsamic dressing. I think it had a hint of lemon in it.  Would I stop by here again & try out the menu? Of course! Plus--I am really a big fan of their nice beer garden/patio. Thanks Amy!

This is one of my favorite places in the city because of the inside/outside atmosphere which makes it especially great in the summer but still enjoyable in the winter.  The food is better than most bars, not my favorite but still very good and I've never had a problem with the service before.  Definitely one of the "go-to" places in my neighborhood

Went here late night on a Saturday and was pleased at having our party of 5 be seated quickly in the outdoor patio. It was packed but since we were outside the noise wasn't obnoxious and our server was surprisingly quick on such a busy night.  I had the falafel wrap, which was unexpectedly amazing! I did not even expect such an offering as a menu item at this place and was nervous about trying something so ethnic at a standard bar and grill such as Northside. But I have to be fair and give them their kudos.I don't know if it is a regular menu item since I have never been here before but it was tasty for sure.  I downed that with a couple of steins of Great Lakes Beer, which was a nice local brew that they had on tap.  The bar inside was pleasing to the eyes but looked a bit impersonal.  Had a nicer time and meal than I expected.

Not bad.  The food was pretty descent, but the service was very blah.  Just didn't really feel like they gave a crap if we were there.  If I wanted that, I'd just go to Potbelly, where they're actually nicer than the Northside people were, and not waste money on a tip.  And I'd gladly tip the Potbelly folks if they were allowed to accept them.  Might as well walk the extra half block to SIlver Cloud, where everybody is super nice and friendly, or go over to Goddess.

A-OK. This place is way better when its warm out and the patio is open. Its very loud inside otherwise.  The food is ok, typical food you'd expect at a bar and grill. Vegetarian options are slim of course. I think the food is a little expensive for what it is.  If you're into margaritas, as them to make you a margarita martini. Its just plain fun.

I have been to this bar once so I do not have an opinion on their food, just the late-night antics.  And this bar did fulfill all my expectations - all being bad. I was there last night (Saturday) and the music was ridiculous.  There would be a quality hit every once in a while, but was generally bad.  The beer selection and prices seemed average but I found the crowd to be absolutely intolerable.  Way too many douchebag guys (Ed Hardy breed) and stupid slutty drunk girls being dramatic and annoying. The staff did seem professional and nice though.  It's a shame that the clientele ruined it for me.

I truly expected to dislike this place but each time I go I enjoy the food and get great service, so I don't really think I can (dislike it).  Some highlights: -The Bloody Marys which come with salami, olives and cheese (make sure you order it SPICY!) -The Lox Platter (on brunch menu) for under $9 you get a ton of smoked salmon, two mini bagels and all the fixins - Nachos made with homemade chips and fresh jalapenos (they use cheese sauce though) - Homemade hummus app served with warm pita With tons of TVs mounted all over the place I love to come here and enjoy the food and drinks while watching a game.

Just stopped in here a few days ago for a beer and an appetizer but I was definitely impressed with this place.  Big indoor space with a large tented semi-outdoor area and a small completely outdoor area that are great for enjoying the summer awesomeness and people watching.  Nice beer selection and the small southwestern pizza we got was excellent as well. Bonus for the pool table in back!

After being sweated on by Naughty by Nature at the Cans music fest, we decided we needed alcohol STAT. So we ran across the street to this place for some much needed drinks. And they were GOOD. Love it when my face gets all numb from vodka and I start up random political conversations with strangers.  The outdoor beer patio is beautiful, a great place to rent out for a party. Great entertainment for simple minded people like me having 3 beach balls bumped around the room for the crowd entertainment.  The food looked and smelled pretty decent from what I saw on other people's tables. I will be back here to check out dinner fo sho.

Pretty decent place to grab some drinks.  A couple of people had food to eat and they didn't have any complaints.  The only thing that really set this place apart from similar establishments in my eyes was the fact we were able to sit outside and enjoy the weather.

Okay, so perhaps not the most raging scene on a Saturday night, but if you're looking for a chill spot to knock back a few cocktails, Northside should be your destination.  A beer garden lover's paradise, Northside boasts some of the best outdoor real estate in the area. It's set in off the sidewalk; Great for privacy, lackluster for watching street traffic, but you can't win em all, eh?  Also important to note: The bartender mixed me up an absolutely lethal O-bomb shot on my last visit. You can't put a price on well crafted shots.

Recently went back here for some beers and food with a friend and had a great time. Our server was very nice and patient- we hadn't seen each other in a while and barely took breaths in between sentences. I had the veggie burger with steamed veggies- sounds boring but wasn't! Some veggie burgers are G.R.O.S.S but not Northside's, mine was moist and very flavorful. The veggies were good too! The beer garden is something to be reckoned with- so it's always a good place even in a monsoon! it absolutely poured the night we were here, but we didn't notice! They cover it up very well and keep the music loud...great place overall.

Is it fair to say that Northside specializes in a fantastic outdoor beer garden? I'd say yes... many a day I'd walk by and envision myself drinking a beer on that patio instead of working. Finally, my time to play came last Sunday afternoon! We were looking for lighter fare so my cousin and I both ordered salads. In a competitive restaurant city full of designer chopped salads, we were a bit disappointed to bite into greens that were pretty average.  I was pleased with the beer list and our service satisfied. Guess we'll be ordering the 'famous' burgers next time! Just a good neighborhood bar with a rockin' patio.

Typical (but good) bar food.  Good service.  VERY LOUD INSIDE - sit on the patio if you don't feel like shouting.  I did really like the sunlights - will be nice in the summer! Nothing to write home about, but a nice place to grab a burger if you're in the area.

I really like the patio.  It's quite large and on a gorgeous day, it's a perfect place to be.  (Day drinking is perfect here.)  The food is ok.  It's bar food.  Some sandwiches, entrees, salads.  The Northside Tuna is fine.  I wish the veggie burger was better.  But honestly?  If I do come here, it's because I want to enjoy the day with a beer in my hand and food that I can just nosh on so I don't get ripped.  And I'm ok with that.

I went on a Sunday late afternoon/early dinner during a gorgeous day and I'd have to agree w/ the previous post. This place is your average bar food with the best seating there is. It was absolutely what I was looking for (in terms of sunlight/view/etc.). The food wasn't bad at all but the waitstaff was - our waitress was kind of bitchy and forgetful. It was about 20 bucks for me & another, without alcohol so not bad. :)

Love the glass ceilings, where even on an icky day, it's nice to feel outside without the negatives of wind/rain/chilliness of being outside.  I went at lunch, so not really a bar experience. The food - somewhere in a decent to good range. The people working there - friendly. The rustic decor & fireplaces - love it! The music - loud. It seemed like they made it louder whenever I got a call too.

Made the mistake of celebrating NYE 2009 here.  It was grossly cheaper than other places and still available.  But I think if I drank on the street corner out of a brown bag I could have had a better evening.  The food served that night, if it was cooked on site, it's not anything I would ever come back to order.  It's decent bar food, better then what you'd get at a bar with a Old style sign.  There isn't any reason I would venture back.  More for a younger 20's crowd, in college or wishing you were back in it.   In the way back is a make shift dance area, currently with a few arcade machines.  The floor is sunken a bit and on a busy (open bar) night say like NYE when booze is just flowing and drinks are spilling, that sunken area gets filled and it's like playing in a rain puddle.  You wonder if the money you spent would instigate anyone to come and clean up the disaster.

I lover their outdoor tables in front in the summer. Sit here all night and watch people go by while sipping on my hard cider and nommin on some great bar food. Love the Chicken strips and the burger. Great service, great food and a great atmosphere. Beware when it comes to shots they will charge you up the wazoo. 8 shots were $85. YIKES Won't make that mistake here again!

"It's really loud in here!" "WHAT??" "It' REALLY LOUD in HERE!!" Previously, I'd been to Northside for lunch and dinner on random summer days and drinks on the occasional weekend-night.  Last Friday was my first time combining the two - dinner on a weekend-night. We had to wait awhile for a table - totally understandable given that we had a large group out celebrating (Happy Birthday to me!).  As we waited, we enjoyed beers at the bar.  All the while, the staff was very friendly and kept us updated as to when we might get a table. An hour later, we were seated.  By this time, Northside had undergone its transformation from "friendly pub with food!" to "trixie dance party!" and my friends and I had to scream at each other to be heard.  Not sure what the deal was as there wasn't really room for dancing in between all the dinner tables and the pool table... The food, however, was delicious.  My friend raved about the mini-burger ("It's Kelly-sized!") and I enjoyed the fish.  Some celebrants were also following Passover restrictions, so huzzah for unleaven bar food. All in all, I still like Northside, I'll just likely restrict my eating to non-weekend times: Friday 8PM - Sunday 2AM = NO EATING All other times = EAT

The food and drink selection is certainly not bad. On the other hand, the service at this cool little place left something to be desired. Nothing can kill my opinion of a restaurant more than crappy service.  Northside is definitely a righteous place for a few beers, but the socially inept DJs tend to bump it even when the bar is half empty making conversation impossible. Recommended for drinks with three or less people, and certainly eat before you head down there.

I can only wonder what this bar was like pre-gentrification. I say this because I've given it a few tries and yet I still don't know what would have caused this place to succeed for so many years.  The nacho platter that I had is the most boring that I've found in the neighborhood, complete with guac that seemed as processed as Velveeta. The salad selection is also pretty sad. This is Wicker Park's original, run-of-the-mill bar, since 1983. Check it out if you'd rather see nothing new.

Stopped in the Northside for a quick weekday dinner with my hunny.  He ordered the Clam Chowder which, in his words, was "not thick enough" and the special Bratwurst, which was "good".  The cole slaw on the side was the most disgusting thing I have ever tasted in my life.... I don't know how you could possible screw up cole slaw, but the Northside did and then some.  I wonder if the chef even tasted what he was putting out?  The waitress was nice enough when we pointed this out. I had the mini burger which was a good size (love when restaurants offer a smaller portion vs. the half pound burger!) and the steak fries which were very forgettable.  My vodka soda was not very strong - I know, I know - which is one more reminder never to order a mixed drink when you don't see the bartender pour it. I really like the building itself (same owners as Logan Bar and Grill) but the clientele is sorta lame... there were many typical Bucktown couples eating after work.  Overall, just sorta boring and blah.  Nothing special worth returning for...

I've always had a great time at Northside! It is such a fantastic venue in the summer... good music, delicious beers and a nice crowd. I cannot wait until it warms up again so the patio is open and the fresh breeze is blowin'! I have never eaten here, so I can't comment on the food, but everything else is great so I imagine the food is up to par!

can we just discuss the fact that nothing on the menu ever sounds really good? it's like, bleh burgers, meh salads, and so-so sandwiches.  service is consistently slow and sometimes just bad.  but shoot. how can i resist the setting? fireplace for the winter, fantastic outside seating for the summer... centrally located....makes it a bit harder to resist, really. disclaimer: the fact that i had an especially lame-o blind date here probably contributes to my ho-hum attitutde about this joint. my apologies.

This is one of my favorite places.......Love it! Very comfortable atmosphere.  In the summer the beer garden is superb.  Over the weekend went there and ate out on the patio  very nice with the clear glass covering over the patio.   I had the Greek Burger, one of my favorites there.  The thick slab of feta makes it all worth while. I did have a "dead guy" amber there.  But also broadened my horizons and had a mimosa with the little champagne bottle.  Excellent.

Decent prices. Decent food. Portions that could resolve the world's hunger problems (seriously, why?? Its insane!). Fireplaces were cool unless you were right next to one, then they were hot. Literally, this place is just a bar with bar food.

Great place to hang with friends or after a day of mountain biking in Palos Forest...Hummus is good and so are the veggie burgers...The summer has great outdoor seating - watched the World Cup here....Its good for those days is so beautiful outside but there is something really worth watching on TV...You get both here.  Love the fireplaces.  Sometimes I have to wait awhile for a drink order....My only pet peeve and the reason for the lack of five stars...My thoughts are as long as you put a drink infront of me, I could care less on when the food comes....or the ordering for the food on that matter!

I used to go to this place pretty frequently when I lived in Wicker Park. At one point, my friend and I became obsessed with the chicken chili, which we would get with french fries. It used to be fantastic, but the last couple of times that I went, it just wasn't as good. I don't know what happened, but it's disappointing. It's still alright, and I'll still go back, it's just nothing special anymore. The service is almost always pretty good, though there was one time that I was there and we couldn't get anybody to serve us, which was super annoying. But usually they are attentive and always keep your water full. In the summer they have an awesome patio area.

I thought this place was pretty good!  Great beer selection---they had BELLS!!!  It was a cute place to hang---fireplaces going in the winter.  I will go back for sure---especially in the summer for the outdoor seating and great beer!

2nd stop of ugly Christmas sweater pub crawl.  This place was hit or miss.  We opted to stand around in the bar area and get weird looks from the patrons sitting and eating their meals.  I just don't see this place being part of my Wicker Park stomping ground.

Great Garden seating in the summer, and cozy fire place in the Winter.  I think the Hummus is the best here.  they used to serve it with fresh fried tortilla chips, but now it is pita. I personally would request the chips.  Also great lemonade here! All in all a good spot in Chicago's wicker park, The have a nice Brunch on the Weekends, with a Bloody Mary that has an anti-pasta side to it.  The out door patio they have is primo in the summer!

I came to Northside for a light meal with my friend before checking out some of the area galleries. This was on a Sunday afternoon, so the place was filled with patrons watching a variety of football games. We just wanted to chat so we were directed to a relatively quiet table near the front. It had been raining really hard for a few days, so the waitress did mention that the floor in this area was wet. This was not a bother to us, though of course the sleeve of my jacket soon took a drink from the puddle behind my seat. I ordered a waffle and my friend selected the chilaquiles. She did ask the waitress if there was any meat in this item and was told yes but can be ordered without any meat. Unfortunately her dish did come with ground beef scattered throughout the plate. I volunteered to switch with my friend, and I did enjoy the hearty plate of chilaquiles though I felt bad that she did not get what she wanted. The waitress did deduct the cost of the chilaquiles, which was a nice thing to do.

Great for groups! Went here the other night for a party.  We didnt set anything up and it suited us just fine.  It wasnt crowded and best part was the abundance of tables and seats. Would def go back, though most likely just for drinks.

I would probably give this place 2.5 stars if I must....  The service was pretty good, and the interior was way cool with the wood and fireplaces, but there isn't any good reason I would make this place my "regular" hang-out.... Sitting at the bar, the bartender gave us our drinks quickly, and was patient enough while we (I) couldn't figure out what to order.  The hummus was outstanding, although I would have liked more pita.   The tuna steak pita wasn't anything exciting, and I had the chicken chili (it was a special), which was chili with some chopped chicken on top of it, and some overly-greasy chips on the side.  Like scarily oily.  It didn't sit well with me whatsoever, and I was "re-tastimg" it all night.  Not a happy ending.

Went here with the guy i'm seeing on a Saturday for brunch. I give it 3 stars because we like bloody mary's and the one's we ordered didn't live up to the hype. Actually they blew pretty hard, i feel like a bitch throwing that out there but c'mon isn't it their thing?  The salad I got wasn't green enough and the chicken that came with it was drenched in sodium. But hey, this place isn't bad at night.

I like Northside; it's always comfortable and who, from this city doesn't know it if you suggest to meet there?  It hasn't changed much in the way that it feels even though the neighborhood has, I appreciate that.  A great place to visit year round for lunch or a good place to start out a weekend night.  Honestly, the music played on Friday and Saturday nights is pretty good too.  The big flat screens make the games easy to watch and the service is alright. My favorite thing about this place is the high force hand driers in the bathroom.  Maybe not really my favorite thing but ...well, maybe it is.  Turbo fast.

When I'm craving some tasty bar food, I typically go here for a couple of reasons, which I will list later.  Lately, the only thing that annoys me is the douche baggy people that have been flooding Wicker Park for the past few years.  In any event, I still like the food and I will tell you what: -the turkey burger with pepper jack cheese is my all time favorite--they serve it on a wheat bun with this black bean salsa that I could eat spoonfuls of, and this creamy sauce that seems like ranch dressing, but I'm still not convinced. -the chicken, bacon and pepper jack cheese sandwich (Obviously, I like pepper jack) is also delich -their steak fries are drizzled with this vinaigrette that makes me excited to eat them  -I really like the hummus for two reasons, 1) they grill the pita, which makes me happy, and 2) it's just good -Wings--they have a good sauce, but can some times be hit or miss -OH!  I forgot the most important part, the bloody marys.  They have just the right amount of spice and they load it with a stick filled with salami, cheese and olives.  Mmmm....

A great patio for sure.   We stopped in for a quick, late lunch in early September and the patio was perfect.  The food was less than perfection, but passable for bar food. The hummus that someone had raved about, I'm pretty sure was from a mix.  I hate that!  Really?  How hard is it for someone to throw some chick peas and tahini in a blender?  I do it at home!   I digress... My Northside salad was very good, loads of fresh veggies and the chicken was well seasoned and moist.  The dressing was good too! Good for a quick bite if you're in the 'hood, but not a destination for me.

Definitely don't go here expecting anything more than what it is-a typical bar with typical food-nothing that makes you say,  'I will die if I don't go to Northside tonight!" But I do enjoy what it is.  A nice place to grab a drink-especially the outdoor seating area.  Server was nice and appeared only when we needed her- magical.  Friend and I split turkey burger (ok) and decided it was not worth splitting so ordered hummus platter (better).   Enjoy conversation, bustling area, and don't expect a typical American bar to be anything it is not!

Fun place. I liked the combination of dining and a big bar in the converted outdoor area. Music was the best part - the kind where each song that comes on you're like "Oh, I forgot about this song..but I love it!".  Food was typical, yet tasty, and although they were busy, came out pretty quick.   The only damper was the table of sit-too-close double-daters next to us, but that's no fault of Northside's.  :-)

Waitresses in FLIP FLOPS! Danger! Danger! Get on the floor! OK. Perhaps it isnt that bad.  But still...I thought that was a food service no no. Maybe not right up there with running into your waitress in the bathroom and watching her NOT wash her hands but definitely looking at her dirty toes while trying to order is rather appalling.   I want to like this place too, I have lived in the area now for 3 years and worked in wicker park a couple of years prior to that..seeing how this place has stood the test of time when many have come and gone...I figured sure, why not?  menu looks promising, even though we were just needing a bit of nosh while watching the cowboys game.  Decor is nice, dark but nice...but that maybe because it pales in comparison to their glorious patio. Ended up just ordering an appetizer (a pretty tasty refried bean dip- but seeing as how is came with guac- I was pleased) and only one drink a piece.  Lets just say I let the service get to me...although she was very nice- the atmosphere of the place didnt suit the lack of professionalism.  if I was in a college diner- maybe.  I counted 7 servers with flip flops! Not one...not one that had just changed and were on their way out the door...but 7.  And yes I counted.  But it was easy.  They were all standing around in the service well by the food window giggling or giving each other hair tips.  Note: dont fix your hair in front of the kitchen! Where a customer can see you!  With that...we paid and left.  Food was very tasty too..but it makes me think- if they dress and act like that in front of house- god only knows what they do in the back!! Ugh.

Food was average at best, your standard American fare. Waitress was too busy at the bar, hardly saw her at all. We got a lousy table in some dark corner. There are far better places to hit up in this area.

The outdoor patio is decent. Great views of bustling Damen Ave. and in the center of a lot of he nightlife in wicker pk/bucktown.  Not impressed with the food though.  It is a step below "good bar food".  I had the salmon salad and the salmon was maybe 3 oz and small and dry.  Decent flavor but nothing special.  My friend had the tuna sandwich and that also looked small and dry.  I'd go across the street to Can's to grab decent bar food.  The outdoor patio is nice and cozy though and always seems to be packed.  Maybe they have good burgers or wings or something but since I dont eat meat I wouldnt know.

The food is OK but the staff seems to always be happy and when you're only having drinks, that's all that matters right?  Cool location, they have an outdoor patio for some quality people watching, and the place seems pretty clean.  I'm a fan.

More like 3.5*.  The menu is, again, typical American fare. The menu's nothing exciting. I was able to get the grilled salmon special for $11.95 that came with vegetables and chives mashed potatoes. While the portions were just enough, it was slightly on the greasy side. The grilled salmon was super tender and flavorful (although my very first bite was super salty! the rest of the fish, however, was fine). The vegetable medley of cauliflower, sugar peas, and yellow squash complemented very well. The mashed potatoes, however, tasted pretty powdery too me and moisture was a bit lacking.  Open air seating atmosphere is great--down to earth and laid back. Definitely seems like a good place to watch any sporting events as they have a ton of flat screen TV's hanging around (mostly in the bar area, though).

I've been here a few times for drinks in the evenings and also during weekend afternoons, and I've always had a good time. Although it can get a little loud at times, it's also a good place to meet up with some friends over a pint or two. A major plus is their outdoor patio. The drinks are decently priced and we had good table service. Recommended!

great food.  service is usually good.  now that it's non-smoking it's all even better.  the atrium area is bright and sunny, lots of TVs if you want to watch whatever game is on.  It's standard bar fare, plus some other stuff, so there's something for everyone on the menu.

Nice place.  I'll be back for the NACHOS - they are huge.  I didn't particularly like my sandwich, but I'm a picky person.  The outside area is really nice.  I'll go back just to sit outside and watch the people walking by.
I thought this was a wonderful little bar and grill. I had a Wrap and bowl of Chili. The food was good. The service was good. Our waitress was quick with refills.

We ended up here by default on a late Wed night, on a return trip from Vegas and needed something to eat.  Tried Blue Line but their kitchen was closed so we trekked a few blocks North to a place i've only had beers at on a few occasions.   The wife liked her grilled chicken sandwich much more than I liked my smoked ham sub.  I wasn't much in the mood for the standard Chicago bar fare of burgers, chicken, fried apps and the like so asked the server her reco b/t the sub or the tuna steak on a pita...I should have went w my instinct and picked the tuna.   Service: Forgettable  Look/Feel of place: 3/5 (decent patio) Food: 2/5

I really love this place!  Mostly because it's a great neighborhood spot to grab a beer, watch the game, people watch and grab a decent bite to eat.  They really do have one of the best outdoor dining/bar areas in the city.  I've always received very attentive and prompt service at Northside as well.  My favorite menu entree is the rotini pasta salad with tuna steak.  I could eat that stuff every day for a month and not tire of it!  And the portion is so big, you easily have leftovers for 2 more meals.

Maybe I should have known better than to go to Northside since I'm a vegetarian, but my mom was starving and that was the only place around with open tables at the time. I ordered a veggie burger and it was nasty. I mean I ate it because I had no choice or what else to eat. I'm not really a salad girl. The burger was more like something from the freezer in jewel.. and I buy those and they are better.. I guess Idon't know what to compare it with it was just bad!

Love the patio and the low key atmosphere right in the thick of all the cute boutiques and cafes along Damen Avenue ... perfect for a summertime break.   I'm a big fan of the black bean chicken chili...delicious.  Their other options are pretty good too.  They have great nachos, chicken ceasars, and hummus plates...all which happen to be my favorite usual orders.  Kick back have a glass of wine, or a beer, and enjoy the night.
